IDy11CI74MxR4a_rXegaAQ.text: The view is great (especially at night). The cocktails are not bad, although at on average £15 each, I would rather go somewhere else... the staff is not so friendly, tries to be too exclusive.

mJJBwKw5j30kimKwW1N5yA.text: Terrible. The only thing good about this place is the view. My boyfriend and I tried to go up early on a weekend just to the bar for literally one drink. I knew you had to make reservations to eat, which we were just in the area so we wanted to check it out. You walk into a separate entrance all together and there is a concierge at the bottom. We asked her if we could go for a drink, she said yeah. OBVIOUSLY we wouldn't have gone all the way up if we knew they were full. We were met by a very rude gentleman and we stated we wanted to check out the bar and view. He stated that if we didn't have reservations we couldn't get in. He was so rude and condescending towards us. It was as though because I didn't have on a label that day I couldn't get in. Needless to say, we won't be going back. I worked in high end hospitality and restaurants and bars, first off the girl at the bottom should have told us there wasn't availability. And secondly they should look to employ some genuine and nice people. Words can't even describe the cold and rude "welcoming" this place gave us.The best part for me is we were going to check out the venue and see if we could rent it out/ part of it for my fiancé's company.  Too bad for them.

sqSf45X0C2N9v7CH9vlIVg.text: Just terrible from the very beginning.  Be prepared to have your purse go through a scanner, then you get scanned by their staff not once but twice to confirm you have a reservation. Then the hostess is blunt enough to tell you that you only have your table for two hours. Are you serious!?My steak was overdone and the green beans came out as peas. The recommendation for a slightly sweet wine was like drinking syrup. I could go on but I think you can make your own decision from here. The view is the only reason they received two stars - and they seriously need to clean the windows, since that is the ONLY thing special about this place.

SBLAbalL225dsPAaS-JElw.text: Views are wonderful. Food is great. Service is excellent. The food was so good that I forgot to take any pictures and only remembered when we got to dessert. All of us enjoyed our food. So go for it, I don't think you'll find any duds on this menu.

fW4pkSwj-44RccfOctHqFQ.text: What is ambition? Is it a mere mortal indulgence that drives us to metaphorically climb to the peak of the highest mountain, stick out flag in the soil, & shout "FIRST?" as if we are users on some cosmic comments section of an online article?Or is it a thirst we yearn to quench, some fragility we are unable to stay against the rising tide of entropy? We quaff, thinning our blood in the dizzying heights, surveying our conquer able city - take up arms, gentlemen! See that boat in the Thames, just below, twinkling in austere glory? It won a war! Your atlas-shouldered burden of life in modernity is surmountable. Leave your card behind the bar - start a tab! You feel an apprehensive twinge in your sternum as you approach the plate glass windows so high up - but this is quite possibly due to your missed dose of Gaviscon, & the kick from the chili martini. It could also be death, trembling in fear to take you, as you live mightily - fiercely, with demigod perspective on the 27th floor- over the sprawling metropolis below! Four stars.

zJR-iHWLWpfxk7zlqjIIdQ.text: Another visit to the Shard and thoughts would try Aqua for my Sisters Birthday. Nicely welcomed and promptly seated with another welcome by the manager when at our table. The views as always don't disappoint and our booth was a good size for the five of us. A nice glass of champagne kicked off the evening. Apart from myself the others in my party were slightly surprised by only one veggie on the main course menu. Although the staff did mention the chef would be happy to propose another option it seemed as though what could be done was very limited. In the end 3 of the group went for the mixed vegetables wit feta cheese option ( from the menu ), with my sister opting for the proposed second option ( Barley rice take on risotto). The appetizers were excellent , mackerel and beet dish was amazing and the added flavoring from the mouse really finished it nicely. Both my mum and sister enjoyed the leek soup and the rest of the group were also pleased with their choices. The veggie main went down well and my rump of lamb was perfectly cooked and well garnished , presentation was excellent .Dessert was also good with us trying a number of different choices - the David's mess was fantastic and really left my palate feeling fresh. The dessert wine and coffee brought the evening to a nice close. A great setting and getting a booking around 40 minutes before sunset is really worth it so you can enjoy the fantastic views of London during both daylight and when lit up for the evening.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Nice evening at the shard - kick into fm with a variety of appetizers for our group

2M-_LA3T0MkHiQNHn7k6DA.text: Aqua Shard : come hungry. Leave hungry, and poor.It started out not great, just trying to find where to go in. I knew the entrance was by the hotel so off I trotted. There was basically no sign posting (except for a carved stone sign that was pointing to the wrong direction, and  half-hidden behind a topiary). Eventually though I found the door - to the right of the hotel - and up we went. The lifts are automated with signs and recordings to not push the buttons - why they don't just cover them with a panel I don't know. So you go up to the 32nd floor, and then have to walk down stairs to the 31st. We arrived at 17.58 but were told we couldn't go to our table yet as the restaurant wasn't open until 18.00 (our reservation time) and they told us to take a seat and they'd get us a drink (spoiler alert - they never did). As we were sitting, I could see the restaurant - empty, of course - and the bar area. The bar area seemed to have the better views, and it was quite lively. They started seating people at about 18:05, so we stood up and went back to wait for our table by the hostess stand. And waited, and waited, while the front of house manager greeted and sat other people. We were told to sit again and wait, with some excuse about the chef finalising a dish. What? I didn't say a word but clearly my face showed my disapproval as we were then told the first round of drinks would be on the house. So we waited some more and finally got our table - at about 18.15. I know 15 minutes isn't a huge delay, but the way it was handled was crap, and considering the restaurant was empty and the tables were all set. We were offered champagne by the front of house manager (not really the same as the first round of drinks, as we had no choice what to order). I declined, as I don't drink alcohol and said as much. We were then offered a fruit juice cocktail, which we accepted. I asked for tap water, and the pompous head waiter replied, "Yes madam, London water". I think that sums it up (note - he brought cucumber water. Gag. At that point, I just accepted it and left it).5 minutes later, a different waiter comes over with 2 champagnes. I said no thank you, I don't drink - and the waiter got defensive and odd. "It's free. Why don't you want it?" I have no reason for not drinking - I just don't like alcohol and it doesn't agree with me. But what if I was pregnant, an alcoholic, on medication? It's not his business. Luckily the front of house manager saw the exchange and called off the waiter but still.The food choice was naff. There was a steak for 2 people - £120. 1kg. As we're not cavemen, that was out - and with only 4 fish, 4 meat, and 1 vegetarian option on the mains, we were limited. I had the veggie option (lentil gnocchi) and my husband had the saddle of lamb. The food took a good 45 minutes to arrive. We did have some nice bread in the interim but come on. No one ever came to take a further drinks order. The view was good, of course, but the place we were sitting by the window didn't look out onto any landmarks, and the way you sit kind of oddly next to each other but facing different directions isn't the most social. Perhaps that's why it was so loud in the restaurant - it was full, and with no carpeting or tablecloths, the noise was enough to give me ringing ears when we left.When our food finally came, it was a huge let down. Tasty and beautifully plated, yes. But I've easily had larger starters than my main. 8 gnocchi, each about a centimetre square - no exaggeration. 2 carrot batons, and what I think was 2 french beans cut into 6 pieces. It came in a veloute (read: soup) but there was no spoon to eat it with. Not that there was really any point in dirtying a spoon for my 3 drops of veloute. Husband's lamb was nice. It came with a potato fondant that was clearly made from a new potato. We also had some fried jersey royals with a spicy tomato sauce on top. They were okay, but the jersey flavour that I was so looking forward to was ruined by the frying and the tomato sauce.Pudding was again tasty but minuscule - the peanut jelly (which wasn't jelly-like, luckily) on the mousse was a highlight. After 2 hours to have 2 courses, we were quite ready to go. I got the bill, which was £80 (including a 12.5% service charge). I put down my £100 voucher and when the waitress came back to take it, she asked if we wanted anything else since there wouldn't be change. I said that's fine, we know, we're done though, thanks. She rolled her eyes at me (why?!) and left. I can't see any reason to return!

ZnkSmeRomQpidqO82iuDog.text: What to say, being there so many times for dinning and drinks. Never let me down, event I'm really picky on those.Just go there, you be loved ones will never be let down.Food:1. Normally you are not expecting great food in such kind of venues, but they take the food very seriously and make them into perfection. 2. Starters: delightful, stylish, tasty, various options can fit almost all situations like if you prefer something light or soup or fish (their Trout and Spring leek soup are great!3 Mean course: super with they grilled beef and their monkfish was to perfection. They all very well presented and tender, tastes great with a great blend of favours. If you can get the right wind with them, you will discover another world of palate.3. Desert: greatly presented, really enjoyed the flavour and always give a great finish to the whole meal.

l2qtLxAe1Pq3LILeDivAdw.text: I was taken to the Aqua Shard for my birthday by my boyfriend. Initially I was blown away with the excitement of actually dining in the Shard! We went in and as my boyfriend had requested a table by the window, we had to wait at the bar, however neither of us minded. He ordered an espresso martini and I had a Tom Collins. Both cocktails were really well made and delicious and served in stylish martini glasses. The menu was the set lunch menu and we opted for three courses. I had the smoked salmon starter and the duck for main with a chocolate pudding for dessert. The food was okay, kind of what you'd expect from a normal British restaurant.The service was good and as it was my birthday, they even gave a separate dessert at the end which was a nice touch. I think that overall it's a nice treat for a special occasion and I think we both had a really nice time, however I don't think that the food was as good as I expected. Maybe my expectation for the Shard was very high (no pun intended) and I did enjoy the experience. I later found out that my boyfriend had chosen this restaurant because in the men's toilets, when using the urinal (which apparently is backed against the glass window), you feel like you are peeing over London!!   Charming eh?

sgiJ0n0NTW49RAMhxFRmag.text: ..... *sigh* the boyfriend brought me here a few weeks ago for drinks and dinner. What we drank and ate was lovely and the service was swift and warm! But to be honest! They are charging you for the view! The beautiful view at night! Its priceless.. I can't tell you I noticed anything but it . so then the food couldn't have been all that! Their cocktails were beautiful though!

jXYDQR52IL78vOBpBV1J3A.text: Looks like a pump, feels like an flip flop!!! Visiting from LA with my best friend and my son. I thought to myself, let's be fancy and eat a top notch restaurant in the famous Shard! After being screened and guided right up by some wanna be CIA'S. We were excited and felt a bit sophisticated so we expected great food to match the ambiance and beautiful view. Well, we were soooo wrong and soooo hungry and soooo broke after the experienve! No problems with the servers though, in fact, they babied us that I thought they would even burp us after our meal. But the food...goodness. Fancy names for crappy and tiny meals. We started with an appetizer called The Hornish Crab, damn thing was so small, I thought we were being PUNK'D! For nearly £20 we thought there was more coming so we waited and waited and my stomached growled. We then ordered the main "entree" some fancy name for FRIGGING BAKED BROCCOLI with what looked like other people's leftovers. We are all hungry and mad to pay £20 frigging pounds for FRIGGING BROCCOLI! My poor child asked me "Mommy, are we poor? Mommy I can't taste anything??" So we paid our bill, left hungry headed to McDonald's.

0xJjKb_xwpkJC50OxjARDQ.text: Disappointing...Asst. wait staff was curt and all wait staff was obviously rushing us to fill the table again from the moment we were seated.Food was okay, but certainly not exceptional.

DUzYcZi40y9Fk77ACP7WBw.text: The view is wonderful and the service is stellar but that is about it as the food is average at best. I ordered the steak and it was 1 cm thick. What a joke considering the cost. Needless to discuss its cooking since at that thickness it is close to impossible to cool it properly. Appetizers were ok but the highlight was the chocolate mousse which was the best dish as attested by our entire party.All in all, go for the view and just enjoy the mousse and you might get your money's worth. Oh and don't forget to use the facilities as it is quite a unique experience!

4Xm_LO3WNSWQOiZzoZHSkA.text: NB: I visited Aqua for a corporate breakfast so can't comment on value for money.We ate in the private dining room, which of course provided stunning views. The cleverly-placed mirrors ensure that whichever direction you face, you will have an amazing view.The vegetarian breakfast included avocado, tomatoes, eggs, toast, hash brown and mushrooms and was delicious. The other options looked enticing, and the full English in particular was enormous! Coffee and pastries were both beautifully presented.Service was good, but overall Aqua has some work to do if they are striving for perfection. The staff got our table's order wrong several times, and the toast was so hard it was almost impossible to slice. The pain au chocolat was too much pain and not enough chocolat! If you get the opportunity to visit Aqua Shard it's probably worthwhile and certainly more relaxed than some of London's other skyline bars. Most of the food was delicious, but there is certainly room for improvement.

6l_mRfaPke4mYgED9MDwjw.text: Yikes. The service here was awful. It's confusing as to whether there is table service or not (actually I am still not sure of the answer) but when my friend went to the bar to order a bottle of wine (so, not the most complicated order) she was told that side of the bar could not serve her, or something. She got so annoyed they sent someone over, who then forgot the name of the wine and had to come back. Arrival to wine arriving took 40 minutes. Not only was that ruining our enjoyment, it's also bad business. How can you make money if you don't serve drinks? They need to hire some more staff and sort it out.Meanwhile, the views are incredible and the bar itself is very nice to sit in with a good buzzy atmosphere. Too bad it's let down by the actual functioning of the bar. In fact, we had intended to go here for cocktails but no one fancied anything on the menu, which isn't a very good sign especially from me given my cocktail addiction.The toilets involve those kind of doors it's difficult not to walk into BUT they have an incredible view. I love toilets with a view.

CWhf5p5dnpdb8hTi_WsSGQ.text: The views are wonderful, as you would expect, but I had high hopes for the food and I was left thoroughly disappointed. Yes I went for lunch, on a week day and so the atmosphere was completely corporate and boring - lots of people trying to be 'important' and discuss equally 'important' things. This was also to be expected I suppose, however the man that seated me with his earpiece was rude and completely unaccommodating, it was like he took an instant disliking to me and couldn't hide it. My enquiry for a different table was met with complete lack of patience and disdain - not what you expect when you spend over 250 pounds on a quick lunch for 2!Then there was the food - bland, and of surprisingly poor quality. The beet salad starter was overpowered by vinegar and the cod was on the verge of being raw. Desert (David's mess) was sugar on sugar and lost the flavour of any fruits that were hidden away despite their gorgeous colours - very disappointing indeed.The cocktails, however were great - I imagine the bar in the evening is buzzy and fun, and the same at the weekend.

jXGkLsbUF5cUD-ZU3akwNA.text: Just a warning, my husband and I used Open Table to make our reservation, but the receptionist said she did not have it in her records. She said that even though we had a confirmation number from open table for our reservation we needed a confirmation email directly from the Aqua Shard. Because it was not a busy morning she was able to seat us at a window table without a delay.The breakfast was good, nothing exceptional (except the housemade baked beans- they were exceptional!). But this did not disappoint because we were mostly there for the view.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Traditional English Breakfast with a view at Aqua Shard

1lmLOqPcAFGXGwfldxM6gA.text: Aqua Shard- review for the BAR only. The view is spectacular. That's why it gets 5 stars. Honestly...You don't pay for anything but a drink~ I think a glass of wine my friend had was about 8 quid if i remember correctly...and my champagne cocktail was 15...I was bad and had another glass of just champagne i think was 14 quid~ (if you go to a fancy, nice bar you're looking to pay that much for drinks ANYWAY...but here at Aqua you get the amazing view...Of course you can't expect the food to be amazing~~ i mean come on... you go for the VIEW. I went on a Wednesday... I read a couple of the reviews beforehand about the long queues~ But on Wednesday night it was awesome... it wasn't empty..but it wasn't packed~ we sat around the bar and then saw a table around the corner and sat there and enjoyed the awesome view. What i liked: 1. The view2. The ambiance (very posh & just makes you feel great to be literally looking down on London) 3. champagne cocktails (yummmmy~)4. the staff was really friendly (to us at least) bartender was French~ waitress and waiter were italian and spanish (all asked where we were from~ etc) 5. THE BATHROOM- i was quite impressed. I mean Aqua itself is beautiful, the stairwell the view...but the bathroom was memorable for me~

rxBV_iBH3a-4afYFX52e5Q.text: "Bad service. Bad food. Bad drinks. Unclean glasses & utensils. All for £203+."I never understood why people are willing to pay top dollar to eat bland, average food - like the stuff your mum used to make - at a top notch restaurant, then exalt the whole experience as if they just met Jesus Christ. Incarnate.What are my qualifications? I've eaten at some top places in the U.S. - meaning I've spent over £300 for dining for two. Plus I've waited previously at fine restaurants (requiring pleated shirts and bowties), banquet halls, diners and more. So I know what is supposed to be done, when, how and why. At all times.Place looks fantastic. Honestly. Course it's strictly average for New York City (where I live), but it's posh so... marks for that.1. Waiting 15-20 mins for any waitstaff to bring menus or even water. Unacceptable in a place so "posh".2. Wine glasses were COMPLETELY covered in lint and dirty - read, soap, water stains AND fingerprints. They even attempted to pour our wine in them. What a class act!!3. Silverware was so knackered - it looked as if it all was used in World War I & II, Vietnam and Desert Storm. That's just cheap.4. Waited 20 mins for our drinks. Unacceptable. 5. When drinks finally arrived, I discovered they left the Bulleit bourbon out of my Royal Julep (Bulleit, Domaine de Canton, Lime juice, sugar, Champagne). Sound good? Not if you're paying over £16 for a drink they "stiffed" you on - but hey, it makes them more money, right?6. Poached & Roasted Hen Of the Woods - is actually a vegetable. Unless it's public knowledge, like on the level of I don't know... WHO'S YOUR QUEEN, it should be clarified on the menu. Otherwise people might think they're ordering wildfowl.7. Slow Poached Veal Fillet. Point to note: if main part of the dish is THAT good, you don't need to obscure the taste. It's best left with minimal garnishments, etc. This came out like pâté and tasted like baby food. Nasty.8. Irish hake glazed in brown chicken sauce. The crabmeat was canned. How do I know - I'm a seafood lover and have eaten enough of both canned and fresh to know the difference. In short, it tasted bad. Returned this dish for the Cumbrian hogget shoulder cooked overnight. That was ok.9. Every dish - the portions were way too small. Just because you pay more and get smaller portions doesn't make you any more of a food connoisseur than it makes the dish haute cuisine.10. For God's sake, SPEAK ENGLISH PROPERLY!! I don't care if it's British or American. And FYI, I speak Chinese Mandarin (also read / write), Italian, French, some Spanish and Russian as well. If I wanted a "foreign experience" I'd specifically go to some place where the native language isn't English.11. Table sections aren't assigned to individual servers. This typically results in far poorer attentiveness from the staff (they tried clearing my girlfriend's drink - still 1/2 full - off the table!, intrusive behavior - too many interruptions and as I mentioned - too long of a wait for everything.12. Wine recommendations. When I asked for a recommendation on some of the red, the staff began explaining what a Merlot is like versus a Cab and so on. What kind of silly prats dine here?? And how is it in a "posh" place that no one has a concept of what the wines are like on the list. I had to learn all the dishes and memorize them - including the drinks so I could aid customers and "upsell". 13. The ladies restroom light was out - so, all the women had to pee in complete darkness.Summary: the owner(s) of this place are clearly trying to screw the customers and line their own pockets with hoards of cash. You saps are giving it to them. I know, I was one. But I won't be again.If you think the food was great, service is top, and food menu selection was plentiful (it wasn't), then you're a silly tw-t and I feel sorry for the people that know you.More importantly, if you're not - I pray you never go here. Best assiduously avoided at all costs. But if you must impress someone - just order a bottle of wine and enjoy the view. This place isn't worth any more than that.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Our glasses were FAR more covered in lint, stains and fingerprints!!

0dGCHC84U6u20YjUMeD-Ig.text: Absolutely exceptional. My parents were in town visiting from New Zealand and I thought I'd take them to a place that has that wow factor. Being the new(ish) kid on the block I thought Aqua Shard would be ideal. My goodness how right I was. We were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived.I had booked a table via the website where I'd also added the notes that I have a gluten and onion intolerance. Shortly after we sat down and was given some time to check the menu one of the waiters came over to check who had the allergy. He then went through the items on the menu that I was interested in informing me of what I could have and what could be modified to meet my requirements. It was so great! One thing I find really hard about dining out is having to explain my intolerances and really feeling like a burden and a pain in the butt, but the waiter at Aqua Shard really made me feel at ease.When we ordered our drinks the bar tender came over to answer any questions about the wine list we had and I asked for a non alcoholic cocktail. He asked me what kind of flavour I was after. I said fruity and he immediately (this really impressed me) asked if I had any fruit allergies. I said apples and pears. He said perfect then went away and within minutes presented me with a wonderful pineapple, passionfruit and mint cocktail. Amazing.The food itself was delicious. I can't fault it. The chicken was beautifully cooked to perfection, the steak was juicy and tender and the halibut was lovely - the sauce complimented it beautifully.  The butternut pumpkin and broccoli sides were good too. And those desserts! Mouth watering! The eton mess was not what you'd usually find in an eton mess in that it wasn't messy... more like tidy! but it was yummy! The dark chocolate tart was delicious - warm and very rich and the vanilla cheesecake had a really nice texture and the sorbet was very tasty. It had more subtle flavours so not overly sweet but just right. And that view. ... just wow. We arrived in plenty of times to get photos of London before the sun set then watched as the sun sunk below London and gave way to night. It was very impressive. The toilets are quite an experience too! Loos with a view. Yes, it is pricey but if you think about the fact you have to pay £25 to go up to the viewing deck, why not pay to go up for dinner instead. The experience is worth it. I'd certainly go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view from Aqua Shard

lKAORWnkQnFCrk-rmDb0UA.text: Booked breakfast here for my husbands birthday.  We were seated at a window corner table. The view from the corner of the Shard was the only thing that made the experience special. Over all Service was poor, food O.K and the price was not worth it. A Full English for two came to approximately £70 in total. This included two hot drinks and Orange juice. When we were seated we were made to feel the orange juice was a welcome free drink! So we were surprised when O.J cost £5 each on the bill! Regards the food itself, it seemed very far from an English breakfast. There were hash browns? American; Spinach and curried beans ? Indian breakfast; cottage cheese - why? Awkward food and doubly awkward vibe. Our waiter told us our poached eggs were scrabbled eggs when they arrived. Mind you if he was reading the menu I can see how he was confused!  Type errors in a menu? That's just LAZY! The haRsh Browns ( exactly how it is spelt in the menu!!) we're as Harsh as the price here. I would not recommend this place for the food or atmosphere. What's the big deal about the view? You can get the same view from top of Guys hospital tower opposite the road.

7wNBP2Zs6tWL9XyXMhuTLQ.text: Unfortunately not the experience it was built up to be.  First the building looks impressive from the outside but that all changes when you get in. After an automated non stop lift to the 32nd floor you arrive at the restaurant bar and over look the floor plan as you're actually a floor above where you need to be. And from here you can see the start of the problems. It is rammed. You cannot see floor space and as such people squeezing through bumping each other etc.  Anyway we where shown to our table, a window seat with great views. Well, what would have been great views had the glass been clean. It was like looking into a mist. If you own a glass building, keeping it clean is a must. After about a ten minute wait our waitress arrived but rather than a welcome or greeting her first words were to tell us we had an hour and a half and would then have to leave!!! Then left!!! Brilliant, a time limit and then she leaves without us being able to order. A few minutes later another waitress arrives and reads out the menu whilst staring out the window without any eye contact, very robotic,Takes our order and leaves. The service is shocking. Not personal at all. When the food arrives it does look good but again the bread was slightly stale and the cakes where dry - and to top it of my scone crumbled as soon as I looked at it. We were now in the mode of finish up and leave as quick as possible. For a relatively new establishment it was tired, appeared dirty and had the feel of a factory . There are 4 restaurants in the Shard and they may all be great but this wasn't and has set a tone for the whole place and wasn't the best. For the price you pay there are much better afternoon teas. The Dorchester, Ritz or Savoy. They may not have the views but each have there own special attraction.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon Tea. Looks nice but not why it seams :-(.

qP1nPXVuZEKxwX_yvxnoiw.text: I find the food is mediocre and the service is the same. Ordered the 3 course fixed brunch menu of lobster egg Benedict, cod fish cake and the chocolate mousse. The lobster egg Benedict was excellent, cod fish cake a bit dry and the chocolate mousse look and taste like grocery store bought pudding. Of course you pay for the view and not the food as quite a few yelpers stated. Another thing I notice is that most guests attire were casual and not smart or business casual as stated on their website and on the post stated on entrance.

39ey3YDLFLvxUrZnSLiBCg.text: THE VIEW!!! We went here for breakfast. It's a pre-fixe menu for £29/plate you get juice, coffee, an assortment of croissants, and a main dish (smoked salmon, Full British, or Lobster Benedict).I ordered the Lobster which was good but tasted basic, nothing too special. My sister got the British breakfast, I liked the blood sausage but the bacon was too tough. When they gave us our orders, my sister's plate had a crumpled piece of paper on it! ON IT! Again you go for the view...maybe lunch or dinner would be better but hey, we had good aerial photos for the same price as paying to go up the touristy area.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. View!
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Breakfast situation.

TsIoVHGIJMWtXsJ7Xawpjg.text: Very very bad experience! Bad food, bad service, and even more, racial discrimination!

ZWNR5IqBiIiYt8R9i9z-ZA.text: This is a large restaurant and bar on the 31st floor, with huge panoramic windows providing stunning views over the City of London and Westminster. My guess is that almost everyone who eats here comes for that reason - and the views are just as good by night, as by day - weather permitting.The lift whisks you up to the 32nd floor, from where you descend via an open staircase into the double-height atrium bar, which is certainly very impressive.As a restaurant, it's quite high end, but for me it does not provide a matching dining experience. The menu is expensive - expect two courses to cost around £60-£70 a head depending on your choice, and you need to add in drinks and service. There's not a lot of choice for vegetarians, but the menu does have the most comprehensive coding system I have ever seen for allergies - not just nuts, dairy and gluten, but celery and other items as well - a total of 14 items.I found the food to be very good, but not outstanding. My spring leek soup with nettles and goat's curd (£12)  - one of those poured in front of you from a little jug - was not just short on quantity, but a little bland and luke-warm rather than hot. Starters came with excellent bread and butter. Better was the new spring vegetable main (£19), which had nicely seasoned and well cooked barley and came with feta cheese. A campanion's steak (£49.50) was very good and cooked as requested. The house white at £35 was perfectly nice - and there are reds at similar prices - but you can pay up to £1,900 for a Chateau Lafit Rothschild Burgundy...Service was very good, to the point of being ever so slightly intrusive - glasses being whisked away the moment you'd finished, that sort of thing, There are time limits depending on the size of your dining party - two hours is normal for four people. And there's a dress code of 'elegant casual' so be warned. The main downer for me was the noise volume: with low ceilings and lots of glass, the noise circulates, and we could have done without the piped disco music from the bar, which was simply unpleasant.So, overall, it's an experience, and the views are undeniably great, but you're paying for the view.

tvgANi96hncXMFbKOXlFZQ.text: Very great view. High quality drinks. Very expensive. Get moved towards the windows as windows seats opened up.

GCPhLasnZYjwmhRVyDHELQ.text: Good spot for cocktails! We came here on a whim as we wanted to go up the shard but didn't want to drop £31 each on the viewing platform. So we dropped it on cocktails instead! Now, you will get eyed up as you go in (Casual Elegance is the dress code, I despise that phrase but basically no sports gear). That's ok though, just dress nicely, don't wear trainers. That said, when we were up there we saw plenty of folks in trainer and sports gear... Once you're up it's really nice, there's plenty of room and we managed to get a table pretty quickly (you may need to keep your eyes peeled). The cocktails are actually excellent and you can order off menu easily enough (I went for a pisco sour and we also got a very niche vespa). The staff are friendly and not at all pretentious. In terms of food - I have a table booked, check back later! Best thing about all this (as a man, sorry ladies) is that you can look out on an amazing view of London as you wee. I'd recommend popping up if you're visiting London or want to go up / grab a fancy drink.

gkaiZbI2BMy71MuRM4eGtA.text: The restaurant is absolutely beautiful!  The views are stunning and the ambience is amazing.  I only wished the food and service were equally satisfying. Unfortunately the service was very slow.  We waited at the bar while our table was getting ready.  I approached the bar to order some drinks but then was told by the bartender that someone will take my order and asked where am I sitting.  I pointed to the table and he acknowledged.  15 minutes later, he never showed up.  We were then escorted to our table which had stunning views.  I mentioned this to the hostess and she returned with two drinks that we wanted.  The waiter then took our orders (Filet and Sea Bass) and filled our water glass.  Did not see him until our meal arrived which was 30 minutes later and we had finished our drinks.  He did not check on us to see if we wanted another drink before our meal arrived, which we did.  The meal itself was good, but not amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Sea bass - just ok...a bit dry
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Side dishes: potatoes, pumpkin, and kale - just ok
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Filet - actually prepared nicely...medium rare

xnRzf59BNH9_1M6E6LdFVQ.text: My fiancé and I had the most wonderful experience here. Everything was wonderful after we passed the hostess. She was rude, inconsiderate, and disrespectful. We checked in with her for our reservation for afternoon tea 15 minutes early, so she told us to hang out at the bar. Totally okay, the bar area had a wonderful view and we were approached by a waitress who told us to take a seat by the window (which we thought were reserved) and brought us our drinks. My fiancé asked me to go check in with the hostess again once our official reservation time was up, and she looked at me like she had no idea who I was (I just saw her 15 minutes prior) and whether or not I was speaking English. When I said I was checking in again, she continued to stare at me blankly, but handed off menus to another hostess to have us seated. The seat that they put us at was in an awkward corner where we couldn't really see anything except the corners of the building. I had put specifically in my reservation request to have a window seat with a view, and this was not what I had imagined. My fiancé saw another table nearby with a better view that was available, so we went back to the hostess and asked to switch seats, and she answered with a roll of her eyes, LUCKILY, the manager came right at that moment and we ignored the hostess altogether and asked her if we could move seats, and she was more than happy to do so.After we moved seats, I was extremely happy about the service. Our waiter (and I so wish I remembered his name! Tall, lean and refined young gentleman) was very attentive and made sure we were comfortable and happy. He made a comment that we were actually sitting in his favorite seat in the house, so we were even more ecstatic. He even offered to take a photo for us, even though we never asked! HE WAS SO SWEET! We ordered champagne with our afternoon tea, and we couldn't have been happier with the service, quality of tea, and quality of food. Towards the end of our meal, another staff member came by our table and dropped off a plate with "CONGRATULATIONS" written in chocolate syrup across it, with a sweet treat and berries added (we are very newly engaged). We were so humbled by the gesture, and it really topped off the entire experience. So moral of the story, BEWARE OF THE HOSTESS. She's a total b****. But have faith in the restaurant itself, they will serve you well. If you are in a rush, I would not recommend coming here... but my number one rule is, you should never be in a rush to enjoy a nice treat or meal. If you are in a rush, you should probably go elsewhere. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this place for amazing views, food, and tea!

ZEsOBtBVxxClGgQTmq5Mww.text: The first thing the hostess said to us as we asked about a table for dinner was, "You need to order a main course for each person."Exqueeeeeeze me? I should have turned around and left right there. Their assumption that every guest that walks in is a freeloader for the view is more than disconcerting. It sets up a terrible repartee from the moment the customer interacts with the establishment.I won't bore you with other details, since they didn't mean nearly as much as the WORST SERVICE EXPERIENCE I'VE EVER HAD. Bullet pointed below, to make it easy for your reading pleasure:- ordered food and wine at 9:30pm- wine served - stale bread served at 9:50- food served at 10:05 .... LUKE WARM AT BEST!!!At this point, we don't see another person for another 30 minutes. No one asks us how the food is, what they can get us, nothing. And we're starving, so we eat. The taste of the food was fine (he got pork belly and filet and I got steak filet), but at £50 for the steak I expect a friggin masterpiece!!! When a filet is good, your hand and knife should do barely any work. I had to shake the table to cut the steak.... but I digress.- plates clear at 10:45, after sitting empty on the table for about 15 minutes- server asks how everything was, we say not great and explain it all, she says she'll send over a manager- 15 MINUTES LATER AND NO MANAGER, no one at all- we get up and walk to the bar, hoping that will spur someone... it did- a manager finally comes over to us at the bar and asks what is wrong, we explain, again- he offers to buy us dessert - UM NO THANKS - and then hands us the check sans service charge and says, "Come back, we'll do better."Again, exqueeeeeeze me? He should have comped our bottle of wine at the least, and the entire meal at the most. Service in NYC, LA, Chicago, Paris, Rome, you name it, would never exist like this. And if it did, the establishment would/SHOULD do everything in their power to have the customer leaving satisfied. $205 in the hole, can't say that I am.I'll never go back again, and I'll tell everyone this story too. So good luck, Aqua, riding the coat tails of The Shard and its views.

y7YEVy9zKMmaURvUOO7G1Q.text: I made reservations here for my family for the last night of our trip to London, and I was unsure if it would be too gimmicky and not worth the price. The second we stepped off the elevator and into the dining room, we knew immediately that the view made it 100% worth it, regardless of what the food tasted like (though turns out it was delicious!). The sweeping panorama of London is truly breathtaking through the floor to ceiling windows. What a classy place. Would definitely recommend it- though it's pricey.

H_CDSEzA13--luvpgI9Fng.text: ZERO STARS IF I COULD GIVE IT. This restaurant has the dubious honour of having perhaps the worst service ever at any restaurant I've dined at in recent memory. 1 star for the nice view over London and the fact that the food is edible. Our reservation was made for 9pm since there weren't any other slots. To their credit, when we arrived the restaurant was very busy indeed, so at least they weren't lying about their lack of availability. Service was poor from the very beginning. We had to flag down a waiter for literally every single request, including the essentials like water and menus. Oddly enough, the glass of wine that I ordered to accompany my main course came out very quickly, even before the bread and butter was brought to the table. At this point, the couple that had arrived at the same time we did finally gave up and walked out of the restaurant after being ignored the entire time. Our food came out after a bit of a wait, although not unbearably long - it was actually not bad; the ingredients were high-quality and tasty enough, although my scallop appetizer was a bit small. After we finished our main courses, someone plopped down another serving of bread and butter, which we found a bit odd. At this point we had already invested enough time and money into our meal, so we decided to go all in and get dessert too. I ordered the mille-feuile and a green tea, yet nothing came out for over 15 minutes, so once again we flagged down our unapologetic waiter - there was no way that they were making mille-feuilles from scratch, and making tea is a matter of putting hot water and leaves in a teapot. Sadly, the tea was not steeped properly and the mille-feuille was a sad heap of puff pasty that had disintegrated into a soggy mess. We were ready to ask for the bill and leave, but once again, our waiter was unavailable - we noticed that he was busy chatting with another table, which had been the case for a significant part of the night. At this point, we asked to speak with the manager. She listened to our complaints, but ultimately didn't do much other than give an insincere apology and offer to comp the tea from the bill. Sadly a 12.5% "service" charge is added automatically, which we found rather insulting given our disappointing experience. As stated in other reviews, the poor service here really turns what should be a pleasant dining/drinking experience into an ordeal. For such a high-end restaurant, the service standards are simply abhorrent - if management thinks that the view alone can keep this place in business then they are sorely mistaken.

umFYJYuHJD1eegPFB_1IXA.text: Location : 31st floor of the Shard - with its own dedicated express elevator. Ambiance : The views are amazing! Its also a classy interior which is modern and trendy! Most of its pretty dark, with some trendy electronic music. There is some form of view from every seat although some are better than others. Food/Drink : We just had drinks (two glasses of wine) and they were obviously a bit overpriced and OK but not great. But since there is no cover charge, we were entirely happy with the prices and experience.Staff : Very professional and top notch.Overall a great experience.

FC1WNFjEZU0MURKv723CvQ.text: Very delicious afternoon tea, and had a great drink. Unfortunately I don't think the view is worth the price. We paid 45ish per person, plus my pretty simple cocktail was 18! Do more research and concentrate on the food-you can see the sites or the view a different way!

zUKwE7TuA9SpYNWnfsiu_A.text: The view of the city is the best in London . The service is amazing and the food was fantastic . Highly recommended

RddmzyiNecwH3dy-XB4J5Q.text: Afternoon Tea at the Aqua Shard:  It's one of those experiences that I am glad I tried; however, I probably will not go back.The view is (obviously) Aqua Shard's selling point.  The restaurant is located on the 31st floor of the Shard with floor to ceiling glass windows.  We were seated by the windows with a view of the Tower of London and the Tower Bridge.  The tea is pretty standard (no creative blends), but the afternoon tea goodies were good overall.  My favorite items included the  lobster finger sandwich, the quiche, and the chocolate ganache that was decorated with a cute chocolate mushroom growing out of it.However, some of the staff came across as a bit pretentious.  When we arrived and asked for a table by the windows (when there were clearly quite a few tables available in sight), the initial response was that there were none available at the moment, but then quickly changed to state that a table by the windows just became available.  Why the unnecessary snobbish attitude?

LhA8wnDyqMboiDQoffDTow.text: So wish I'd read these reviews before heading to Aqua Shard for breakfast. It sounds like my experience echoes a lot of other Yelp users' experiences as well i.e. not impressed. Alex S. put it better than I ever could (as it sounds nearly exactly like what happened to us), but I just felt that the overall experience - from the atmosphere to the decor to the food was just so-so for what is promoted as an upscale restaurant. Honestly? I much prefer the food, service and views at Duck & Waffle. The menu at Aqua Shard was nothing out of the ordinary and the quality was mediocre, at best. The muffin as part of the "selection of pastries" (which were miniature versions of pastries, smaller than my palm) was dry. The other pastries, however, (pain au chocolat, pain aux raisin, croissant) were flaky, delicious and served warm. Our lobster benedict was tasty and the lobster well-seasoned.Service was sporadic to non-existent. Our teas didn't arrive until after our mains were served and I would have liked to have it with our pastries. After the pastries had been taken away, we were left with the jams, which confused me - should I slather this on my lobster benedict? Are there more pastries to come? Sadly, I'll never know.Despite not having been open for *that* long, the decor looked worn and tired. Our table had chips to the surface and scratches - it felt like dining in a relic of the 90s. The view was lovely ... if you have a table by the window. Aqua Shard specifically states on its website that you cannot reserve window seats, which I understood, but if you're sitting at a table away from the window, the atmosphere is lacklustre and the tables are situated in such a way that you can't really see very well beyond those whose tables and chairs are literally touching the glass. Great for them. I did think about taking my friends and family here when they're visiting London, but I think I'll stick to the views elsewhere.

lpaxB7BQfaUfZwyld7aXjQ.text: A magnificent view!The food at brunch was excellent.  The menu only shows a three-course pre-fixe but you can order just two courses. (However, the minimum is two courses.) My hot and cold soup and swordfish were both excellent.  My friend said her duck egg was excellent. I forget what she had for the first course but she liked it.  We both agreed that the chocolate mousse with berry sorbet was fantastic.  Although we had been there less than hour, the server started pushing us to leave so the restaurant could turn the table over.  However, she found us a table next to the window in the bar area which actually had a much better view than the table at which we had eaten.It was more than 20 minutes before someone took our drink order in the bar.  They certainly seemed understaffed. In sum: great view, great food, mediocre service.

Bx5_WF43KyWmaDJw_FL_YA.text: I've been here twice. First was afternoon tea for my Mothers 60th birthday and the second was for an evening meal. Both occasions were brilliant and the views are spectacular. On my first visit we were lucky enough to be given a corner window table. The service here is great and the staff are really helpful. The cakes and sandwiches are delicious and they have good selection of teas. We spent a nice few hours eating, chatting and drinking tea. As the sun starts to set, you get a whole new view as day to turns to dusk and then to night. Although it's not cheap, it's a wonderful place to take someone as a special treat.My second occasion I was lucky enough to be taken out for diner with a group of associates. We had such a good time. The food was amazing, as was the atmosphere. Once again the staff were friendly, professional and nothing was too much trouble. My starter was the goats cheese salad which was really nice, followed by Lamb. I found the Lamb perfect in every way and I really recommend it. During our dining experience we had the most amazing sunset which illuminated the whole restaurant, this was quite magical.I really love this place as it's stylish without being pretentious, has superb views and is like dining in the clouds. The food here is excellent and I had no trouble booking a table. My only slight criticism is the gents bathroom isn't easy to find, but it's such a minor thing that it won't affected my rating.

Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Tasty lamb
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Goats cheese salad

f45M7ixlwd_S39Kmqpwbbg.text: Unbelievable views of the entire city of London! A perfect spot to watch the sunset with a cocktail. I love everything about this place!

VNEd7YiCwEEZgFL2utkqMw.text: This is a review for their afternoon tea. I took my mom here because she loves a good view and doesn't care so much about the food. That's fine, I figured that we were really paying for the view so I came in with low expectations. Sadly, it was worse than I even expected. The table we were given was off to the side with mediocre views due to the Shard building obstructing the views. The place wasn't full so they could have given a bit of a better table. They mention you need to let them know about any dietary restrictions ahead of time. My mom was vegetarian and my dietary was noted and confirmed days before we arrived. On arrival, we were asked a number of times if we had any dietary restrictions. We then proceeded to wait almost a full hour for our afternoon tea sandwiches and pastries to be served. They also gave my mom only three sandwiches instead of the standard four - huh? She's paying the same price for a cheaper tea and they can't even give her four sandwiches? All the bites were incredibly bland, dry and forgettable. Service was almost nonexistent and we had to consistently try to catch someone for refills on tea, to get the bill, etc. For the price, I would go anywhere else in the city for afternoon tea. Should have just stuck to Fortnum and Mason or the Ritz! The view isn't worth the price and mediocre afternoon tea. Definitely will not be back for the tea...

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea (45)

nuWM9iLucp4gskFfEmAAeA.text: If zero stars were possible this place would score that! We booked brunch at 10:30am Sunday morning. Arrived promptly for our reservation and were quickly seated. The menu is prix fixe on the weekends. £48 mandatory 3 courses. Most of the dishes were very savoury and didn't feel much like breakfast/brunch at all. Given we'd just woken up and came straight there a full 3 course lunch didn't feel right. As it turned out the table across from us was also not aware of this. We asked our Italian waiter if we could just order a la carte. He seemed enormously inconvenienced by us asking questions, and said no, it was mandatory, but the manager said we could order just a main for £24. Minimum 1 x main course per person. We decided to leave, it all seemed a bit silly! We popped by the reception desk and let them know that a fixed price is fine, but you need to make diners aware of that. None of the staff had a particularly gracious manner when dealing with complaints and seemed to believe this was just the norm. So we hopped straight back in the lift and headed elsewhere.  There are so many great options on Bermondsey Street just around the corner. In summary -  lovely view, staff quite up themselves, exxxxxpensive!

KxiWaeusx3jAMhS_qZVd9A.text: I wanted to treat my mum for her birthday and thought a fancy breakfast up the shard would be just the ticket. I had heard service could be a bit snooty so went expecting the worst. The front of house staff were really nice, the only issue we had was with someone in the restaurant. We were seated back from the windows but there were window seats free. When I asked if we could sit at the window I was told these were reserved for other people who were just coming. They never came.  Eventually he agreed to move us but reluctantly I must add. We were there first,  I don't see the problem! The view is undoubtedly amazing and the food was really nice too - we both had fry ups. Also had some breakfast cocktails which were yummy! The setting and food made it very special, just that issue with the table that let them down.

K2bIV_mLN5f5KbwDgZ-y0g.text: I had heard great things which mainly revolved around the great view.My girlfriend and I went there just for drinks and it was really great, the amazing views definitely enhanced our experience.I'd definitely recommend going there for drinks and the view!

DzuNQW73_QKJVVfHkAlunA.text: If you're going to the Shard, skip Aqua Shard and go to Hutong instead. The view is not worth the headache. My parents and boyfriend were recently visiting from Boston / New York City and after a week of great dinners at various places around London, I brought them to Aqua Shard on their last night here, thinking it would be a nice British-style twist on Hutong (the restaurant one floor up, which I frequent and like very much). Boy, was I wrong! The view is fantastic, but that's about it! To start off, I had made reservations about a month in advance for a table at 6:30pm on a Sunday because everything else was apparently booked. When we got there, there were tables empty for hours (with nicer views) but they stuck us at the back of the restaurant, which seemed very odd to me as the other tables did not fill up while we were there. The waiter was very unfriendly from the start, and every time we asked another waiter / waitress to help, they pretty much ignored us. We ordered appetizers and drinks to start (cocktails, followed by wine for the main course). The appetizers were fine (hence the 1 star), but the drinks all came out after we had finished (our wine did not even come out until we had finished our main meals) and we had to continuously ask for simple things like an extra fork, bread plates, olive oil for bread (I think we asked about 4 times for this)... it was like nothing was coordinated and the server would bring one thing at a time (like one glass of water, or one napkin, rather than servicing the whole table at one time... others might need water / napkins as well!...). We didn't really complain to much upfront and just rolled our eyes as we continuously had to ask for things. It was my parents' final night in the city and we just wanted to enjoy the food/view, and not be frustrated. When our main entrees came out, that's when I absolutely lost it. I had ordered Dover Sole which was about the size of my finger (and had bones in it, which took up half of the size) with a side of three (3) very small gnocchi. I'm a small girl, and wasn't expecting a huge plate, but paying £33 for that is utterly embarrassing. I tasted it, hoping it would be the best fish I ever had, but it was cold and dry! Everyone else's dishes at the table were equally appalling. When we called the waiter and the manager over to the table, the waiter didn't really seem to care, and the manager couldn't really do anything to fix our over £200 bill. He acknowledged that there were issues with the coordination and apologized for the table location (which, to be honest, was the least of our worries). No one came after that for a long time and we just sat there waiting for our bill for about 20 minutes (there was no way we were ordering dessert or champagne, as we had planned to do). It was really a shame that this happened to be the restaurant I chose for my parents' last night in the city, because it was a special night and I was really expecting more. I will not return to this restaurant (but will continue to frequent Hutong) and encourage others to not go to Aqua Shard either.

E86on69zQjcaw7Xg9o0QxQ.text: I've only been for drinks, so I'm giving it a 4 based on that! Whilst it is pricey, it's amazing for a special occassion/showing off London to a visitor. Beautiful views in a stunning setting!

lA52_wwE5EIUVFbjk61wlA.text: Visited Aquashard for brunch on Saturday, for 4 people on the set menu it came to £218 (3 courses and a cocktail).  I thought we might be served up "dog food with a view" but in fairness the food was actually really good.  We had to ask a few times to get moved out from the booths at the back to get nearer the view - there are only tables for 2 set beside the glass - so if you are with a slightly larger group and they try to place you at the back just be persistent!  I also got told off for putting my jumper down when trying to get a picture with the view - not a very impressive way to treat somebody who has just spent hundreds of pounds at your restaurant.  But these are minor gripes.  I would recommend a visit.

w92rDDeGL0rfzVKFPw1xSA.text: Note: this review is for the Cocktail Bar @ Aqua Shard. The amazing view aside, I thought that my visit to Aqua Shard was throughly mediocre, with beautiful cocktails being drowned by less than impressive service (even during a non-peak time). A simple order of 2 beers was forgotten and after asking other over-stimulated bar staff to help us (and being ignored), we eventually cornered one into giving us the bill such that we could continue somewhere else. Come for an amazing cityscape of London, but brace yourself for what could be a frustrating hospitality experience.

D1Md-VJW04U3Nz894kHAnw.text: Went to the bar for drinks. Service was terrible. All the staff are super snobby. Took 25 minutes for waitress to take order even though it was nearly empty. And they add an automatic device charge.Cocktails are ok, if overpriced.

nKmnzVJu6InkEFSDGM73xw.text: Nice place as long as you look out of the windows.. Inside staff is rude, food is as so often small portions of boring food served on large square plates.. not worth my and your money.

UqMe2bEJ7tCEFb10-Mn72g.text: This place has an amazing view but that's the extent of it. Slow service punctuated with occasional rudeness. Drinks are as expensive as you might imagine. Generally a very average experience.

6uTSSBF7hCB87jD948_Vyw.text: Great view, great cocktails. Cannot say anything about the food. Didn't have any. Nice place to impress our-of-towners. Came here on a Monday evening and managed to get in without any hassle.

jya8SbelT5ybXsbNvolLFg.text: This is review for the bar at the aquashard.... The only good thing about it are the spectacular views....The rest - terrible. Long queues (expect to wait 40 min,  reservations not possible), staff is not customer oriented (they forgot our drinks, slow service even though the bar was rather quiet), the cocktails are not great (and naturally  overpriced), and they don't have a decent selection of alcohol free cocktails.

gndOJJ1n6miW-LvocStu4w.text: Had the most splendid time with my boyfriend here. Nighttime was magical-- view was breathtaking! I liked that it was rather loud with music in the background-- gave a nice touch to a fancy place. staff was very good. While the food was average, the experience was quite incredible and well worth it.

ripsuRzk0_lb8ibMNgFLig.text: Very impressive, not just for the gape-inducing views over the City of London. Slightly slow bar service initially, although table service later on was impeccable. Wait staff for Africa. Food was erring close to Haute Cuisine which i don't like, however a starter and main proved a good amount of food. Everything we had was amazing. The wine i chose was a let down, but being a viticulture philistine i cant hardly complain about that. A West facing table could have been the only improvement to watch the sunset...Meal ran us 145 for the two, and all things considered this was good value i thought. Worth going for the bathrooms - surely the best urinal view in London!

SUbquJTQxPWdiB6zla3ekw.text: Enjoyed dinner at aqua shard tonight.  The food was good and prices were a little high as can be expected for a spectacular view.

O1s8QqXlKfeis1tmtC69lA.text: The AquaShard has the most amazing views of the Thames, Tower Bridge, Tower of London and lots of other important vistas.First we settled in for a couple of drinks while we took in the extraordinary vantage point from the 31st floor. The service in the bar was extremely slow.Once transferred to a very nice table right by the window we had a lovely dinner accompanied by a bottle of wine. Prices are what you would expect from a fine dining establishment in downtown London in the tallest building in European Union.I'd have to say we were quite amused that when we both requested a side of potatoes they had run out. Seriously, a British restaurant that runs out of potatoes? I'd think there'd be a law against that!Otherwise very good.PS The loos also offer an amazing and breathtaking view. Spectacular!

1beJRlbHWqq3HWAyGiJDZQ.text: I came here for the 3-story bar & the view with a group of friends. The view is stunning but the service is too slow. After waiting well over 45 minutes to order some drinks we found a table to settle down. 6 of us were seated and I got up to admire the view- having had one sip of my drink I placed my drink down alongside my other friends. It was no more than 1 minute before a waiter quickly took it away from the table.The drink was clearly full! Yet- the waiter took the drink. My friends did not even see him swoop in because it happened so quickly. I complained to the bar as just having spent 16£ on a cocktail - and they made me a new one but this took an additional 30 minutes of me waiting at the bar as had such a long queue. Please be more aware of your customers & do not just take drinks away that are full when it is in the middle of a table surrounded by 6 people. It is quite cruel considering the entire ordeal took me 75 minutes to sample 1 drink. I feel as though more could have been done by management to bring a new one to my table instead of making me wait at the bar an additional 30 minutes for my 1st drink. View & drinks were good but with poor service.

zA1Wv7HocYULWSYyDZ02qQ.text: We went to the bar only. Had two great cocktails (yes they were a bit pricey but they were fab. And lethal!). We found the staff really friendly, happy to talk to us while we sat at the bar. Views were amazing. I'd be happy to go again!

Xvyn762AspEuKtevRqyFRw.text: My husband and I eloped in the Viewing Gallery and made reservations for dinner at the Aqua Shard thereafter. The manager, David Boyd, went out of his way to make us feel special on our wedding night. He gave us the most beautiful table, view and personable service. We felt like we were sharing the night with old friends. The food was amazing as well, and the sommelier paired it perfectly with a spectacular wine. The Aqua Shard is a must visit, and we cannot wait to return!

-jKnR3wp8mV0sUqzvZ7OOQ.text: I was unsure of whether this was going to be worth the price (or the view) but I was pleasantly surprised. I had the seared foie gras for starters (amazing..really rich & fatty -  yum!). Next was the suckling pig confit for mains..though was struggling to pick between this & the steak. Really glad I went with the pork as it was fantastic. The truffle potato gratin was so so good and there was a perfect amount of it on my plate (again pretty rich so as tasty as it was you wouldn't want more). We decided to share a dessert. We got their version of Eton mess & it was way too sweet for me. 2 out of 3 - not perfect but pretty damn close. Overall I was still really happy we came here. The service was attentive and the view was everything you'd expect. Only thing I would recommend they do is to can the live band..really loud in what isn't really a big enough space..you'd need to be an awesome band for it to work.

R1or7rX3DeQeZtt2zruv1A.text: Posh Brekkie...exquisite experience! I've given this 5/5...for the view, experience and extreme professional service. The food was nice, and there was no debating the quality ,however the portion was miniature. It was definitely a one-off breakfast treat , which I would recommend for a birthday or anniversary celebration!

9lswyynMHqLk1lR0xRlwCw.text: Beautiful view, average food and terrible service.  Left waiting twenty five minutes and counting after completing our meal to have someone collect our check and "find the card machine" to cash us out.  Wasted time on our trip.  Definitely better places in London to spend your time.

2Aj_jySDzXtDDR91bQL2Pw.text: I visited Aqua Shard for NYE dinner. I think it would be a great 4 star restaurant normally, but it gets docked 2 stars because of the weirdness of NYE the night I went. First, the Shard is an icon in London, as it is the tallest building. It is also very accessible using the underground transportation. It's views attract tourists and locals alike, and it is located in a very hustle/bustle area. We tried to book reservations in the bar area in September, but it was already filled up and now I know why. We therefore reserved a table for dinner, looking over the London eye side of the tower. Although we paid much more for these prime views of the fireworks, hoards of people ran over from the bar side of the restaurant to block our views of the fireworks. They used our chairs as stepping stools to see over the crowd and our table as theirs to rest their glasses :/ it wasn't the most pleasant NYE celebration to say the least. Book the bar side of the restaurant for NYE, then run over to ruin the views of the guests dining there. But don't go for dinner expecting to have a relaxing, comfortable view of the fireworks. The dinner itself was great. I enjoyed the lobster and steak, as well as the "complimentary" cheese platter after dessert. The service was ok... Nothing special, in fact I think we would have ordered more drinks if they were more observant/checked on us more. It was a little weird that they had to check who were like 4 times that night: first, at the entrance of the hotel, second, at the entrance to Aqua shard, third at the bottom of the stairs of Aqua shard, fourth at the table. With so many staff members milling around, you'd think they'd be more organized.Unfortunately, I don't think I'll be back. The company I was with made my night, not necessarily the views, awkwardness or uncomfortableness of watching fireworks smashed up against the window with 100 other people.

pytbdzeXmIjc3qnOThLxCA.text: We were in London for just a few days and wanted to experience the English Tea tradition and decided to go for afternoon tea at the Shard.  It's a good location and we just walked over after our tour of the Tower of London. We loved the ambiance and it seems to be THE place to go for locals too. Anyway, though this was not one of those fancy teas with pretty china, the views more than made up for that. And the service is great.

kwW-tAh2quElgyJfR17rLw.text: The first thing is the amazing view of 32th floor...! I was for dinner, with my fiancé  yesterday night and the particular note is for the kind and friendly staff. We received the table to far to the  windows but the waiter after dinner invite us to move for the dessert in front of the window with London Bridge Tower view.. AWESOME!! P. S. : The food is not as spectacular as the atmosphere of the restaurant. I suggest this place only for a drink

Go there for one drink, enjoy the view, and then meander elsewhere. Biggest regret: not going to the bathroom at the Shard. Supposed to be one of the best toilet views in the world. dGCtFgjPn8fSoW_qhPH1bQ.text: Went here for a business dinner and couldn't have been more pleased. The view was spectacular, but the food and service were even better. It is a can't miss dining experience.

gdNqN0X5KEcFBEvhf4B4Ag.text: Was in London for a few days and decided to get a bird's eye view from the restaurant.  I planned my reservation around sunset, and couldn't have asked for better seating on a most wonderful night.  The west side was spectacular with clear weather!!!  The food complemented the experience, with my order of the cornmeal porridge, roasted halibut and buttered spring greens.   The passion fruit martini was my favorite!!  All said, the view was worth the cost of the meal.

There were plenty of seats available but they would not give us the table. We also asked to refill our water 3 times before they brought it to us. And yes we were limited  to 2 hours for high tea.

NddLbTZAnkVM4u31mKu8CA.text: The worst restaurant I have ever been! The food is very poor quality and doesn't have any taste. The hygiene is 0 out of 10 and service was below of an average cheap restaurant level. If you want to be ripped off go for it. The windows look dirty, old plates and not washed well and the napkin was with a huge dried spot from previous customers. Was promised two times to change the table by the staff and no one changed it. Some customers were looked after better than others as I could see they judge people by the looking. The main course I have ordered was lamb and 3 hours after having ot I still had nausea and almost going to vomit on the way back home. Overpriced cheap meal with dirty windows view trying to look posh but looking cheap and dirty. Not luxury at all. Do not recommend!

MHkti8AjvIf3x5ODVe-8dg.text: So last night was my second time at Aqua Shard. The first being just after it had opened. I wasn't very impressed the first time and I had put it down to it being a new business. However, it's clear that the same issues we had first time around are still clearly there. It's also way over priced for what you get. I understand that it is a high end tourist spot. Free entry to see the view of London 31 stories up. So they probably get a lot of tourist not wanting to spend money but wanting to check out the view. I also understand that the staff will get a lot of people who don't speak a lot of English or who don't know the English tipping system or who don't know what other facilities are near by. They are also probably used to people moving around to get seats with better view of London. I also  realise these repetitive situations will make their responses seem short and blunt. I was, however with a group of English people. I also work in London Bridge. We asked simple questions and got no response in reply. The staff were, the majority of the time, down right rude. For example the bill says a discretionary tip can be added but the waiter forced us to add the tip. Oh and finally you can't make large reservations here either at the bar. The Walkie Talkies roof Gardens is free and the staff are much more pleasant. Go there.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Cocktails with a view.

dgEwmIFJI4CXG__cY5dovw.text: What can I say about Aqua Shard? We had won a gift certificate to use there and were excited - then we read all the reviews. I'll cut the story short - generally the service is as bad as you've read elsewhere.  So we arrived a couple of minutes to six, as that was when the reservation was for. We had our coats checked and were told to sit and wait. Some time ticked by and others who were newly arriving we're being taken to their tables. So we got up and asked to be seated again, only to be told to sit back down. Another ten minutes and finally we got seated in the actual restaurant. There was some excuse about the chef cooking a new dish - well that didn't make any difference to us reading the menu and ordering drinks actually in the restaurant.We were given a couple of cocktails to compensate for the delay, and we did get a window seat. But the lighting and the table setup were odd. Basically you have a spotlight on the middle of the table - meaning that whatever it is that your eating is in perpetual gloom. Plus you have to sit next to and not opposite the other person. But of course the view is the thing.Despite it being free, we decided to opt against any of the starters and went straight to mains. I had the lamb saddle, while the missus had the lentil gnocchi. We finally got our mains and technically our first course some fifty minutes after being seated. The gnocchi was hilariously small and could have passed for a started. Mine was a little bigger but although the majority of mine was good - the mouthful I got with the lemon gel unexpectedly was horrible. But at least it eliminated that gel in one mouthful and I enjoyed the rest.For desert I had the restaurants version of an Eton mess, while the missus had the peanut jelly. Both were good, but again hers was tiny. Admittedly the service did turn up when we needed them, but it always took a while. No one came to check if everything was ok, and the servers were stern to say the least. I'm simply glad we didn't have to pay anything for the experience. I know they must want a michelin star for here, but while the location suits, the service doesn't come close and the food tries entirely too hard.

Y1pzRmVaINBdgN3MGBPkrg.text: While in London, under the recommendation of our local relatives and online reviews, my husband and I went to Aqua Shard in London's iconic building for an afternoon tea with a view. While waiting for our table to be ready, we waited at the bar area and ordered ourselves some cocktail. I got the Passion Fruit Brulee. It is by far the best cocktail I have ever had. The caramelized creme brulee foam is light, fluffy and just heavenly. Although this is a fruity cocktail the drink was not too sweet. You definitely taste the tartness of the passion fruit. We got seated by the window almost immediately after getting our drinks. Even on a misty day, the view from the Shard was absolutely amazing. Once seated, we were given a choice of tea, I naturally decided to go for the English Breakfast (being in England and all). The tea was good but nothing extraordinary (I think I was too busy sipping on my cocktail and champagne). The sandwiches were by far the best I have ever eaten. It was so hard to resist licking my fingers and plate. I liked the finger sandwiches so much that I was tempted to almost pay for another round of champagne and afternoon tea just so I could have more of those sandwiches. The scones and cakes were equally good. Out waitress was very friendly and attentive. Despite the high price tag I would have given this place 5 stars and highly recommended this place to everyone. Until..just when we were getting ready to pay our bill the fire alarm started to go off in the building. I do no blame the restaurant or the building for the alarm because these kind of things happen. They even did a good job evacuating everyone in a timely manner. After waiting in the rain for almost an hour we were finally allowed to go back in. We could have decided to leave like some of the other diners rather than just wasting out time waiting but we still had our coats and umbrellas checked into the coat closet upstairs. When my husband went to pick up the belongings I went to pay for our bills. I was shocked that a place of this caliber would make me pay the full amount! I know the fire alarm was not their fault but you should give some incentives to your customers for the inconvenience so they can rave about your place and even become a returning customer. Chucking it out to maybe that is something they would only do in the states I continued to wait for my husband. In the 5 minutes it took for him to come back with our belonging at least 3 staff members asked me if I paid my bills yet. The next day I got a call from a woman who claimed that she was the manager apologizing for the inconvenience. I thought maybe they had called to offer more than apologies. Couple of minutes into the conversation I realized that the woman was trying to figure out if I had the bills without just coming out straight and just asking me. Once I told her, "Oh yes we paid before we left." She just said, "Oh OK we just wanted to make sure managed to pay." and hung up! Again thinking maybe this is the British way I ignored it. A few days later I told this to a group of locals over dinner what had happened and they were all appalled. I really hope they handle situations like this better in the future. You don't even have to give discount but do not start chasing people for every penny. Despite the "fire alarm" situation if given the chance I still recommend this place for the amazing cocktail, sandwiches and dessert.

zAP0JDuBd4eEpc2y4flROw.text: Had a lovely sunset brunch here (achieved by getting their latest possible afternoon booking, at 3PM, in the dead of winter when the sun sets around 4). Like other reviewers, I was put off by the multiple layers of security and bouncers - they are definitely trying to keep the riffraff out, which always makes me fear they'll just look at me and say "nope." But they let us in and seated us at a table with a lovely view (not window, but close).We were prepared to spend an obscene amount of money for "brunch," which we did. The wine selection was excellent, the three-course prix fixe was delicious, and we enjoyed the view, the sunset and all the lights in the city coming on. It's a great splurge for a visit to London.

d2FX-AN7FdoP_0YkNSPfFg.text: Aqua Shard is the place to visit if you want to enjoy the amazing London skyline with lovely drinks. I would recommend to try to catch the sunset because it's extraordinary. We came here for drinks on a Saturday without reservation and were blessed with a table within 5 minutes close to the window. Another party of two who bought their drinks at the bar tried to steal our table but luckily the server sort of ignored them. Drinks are definitely on the pricey side but you get what you pay for in terms of the experience, atmosphere and view. A side note is that I find that the setup is quite similar to the Aqua in Hong Kong! :)
