dH_XTxUKIYiJrZuAlUzujQ.text: I absolutely loved my experience at the Aqua Shard. My fiancé and I had brunch. I had a non-alcoholic passion fruit mojito which was delicious and very beautiful. The decor and atmosphere at the Aqua Shard was breath-taking and very lavish. There were extremely high ceilings and clear windows everywhere so you couldn't escape the city view of London. It's very important to make a reservation or else you won't get a table. The service was okay. The food took ages to come out. The food was very tasty. It was very beautifully decorated and high quality, but it was extremely overpriced. The prices were a bit insane. Honesty. I'm not one to complain about prices at a restaurant but it was a bit over the top for what it was. The prices were a bit insane. I had dinner at an amazing Michelin star restaurant for a cheaper price so it's a bit insane. But I think their brunch menu was also lacking a lot of originality and uniqueness. It was very basic. I didn't really like it. The tiny portions, the price and the basic menu...come on. I'm sure that they could do a lot better.

jBgDyX1C2l36nfDp4tcwlA.text: 100% worth the view but the service is absolutely slow and terrible. The food was great just make sure you come with good company and get a spot by the window. You'll be waiting long.

gLRnZo2-AiolPiYsQnHp8Q.text: My friend and I tried the Set Breakfast Menu here (29 per person w/o tax) and truly enjoyed our experience! This set includes juice, tea or coffee, a selection of pastries, and entree - I went for the classic orange juice, coffee, and Severn & Wye Smoked Salmon. We were given a mix of all different pastries to share (pain Au chocolat, croissant, blueberry muffin, white and raspberry muffin), which we enjoyed with our juice and coffee. Each pastry tasted amazing, but pain au chocolat and blueberry muffin were my favorites. I was already full by this point and although the entree took a while to come out, we used the waiting time to take pictures - the view is absolutely spectacular. When my smoked salmon came out, I was immediately impressed by the display - everything looked so beautiful. Also, the various spreads I was given fit so well with the salmon and the bread. My friend got the Shard Full English breakfast - she enjoyed hers as well, but it was too much for one person to eat. If you want something lighter, I would suggest the salmon, although I left feeling extremely full! Overall, highly recommend!

jwkr7HUnNSBKnW_cUkJ00g.text: You are paying for the view and the experience. After having the full meal I would suggest just grabbing a drink at the bar rather than dinner.  Heres why...There are limited options for both appetizers and dinner.  We tried some crab appetizer and it just didnt taste very good. It was a crab salad and was not very appetizing.For entrees we ordered the fish and the lamb. The lamb was pretty good but I heard from my fiancee that the fish was not too flavorful.  All entrees are presented well but not the best flavor.For dessert we had the cheesecake that was a deconstructed version. Idk it just didn't work either.Overall service was outstanding.I would definitely come for a drink at the bar and eat somewhere else.

LyFrPzZb_h_fOU3aOzmkBQ.text: We went for dinner and view was great and became better as the evening went on.  The service was somewhat slow as there seemed to be confusion amongst the two waiters attending our table.  The drinks were delayed and the dinner wine was brought far too early.  Very glad that the wine was decanted.  They did a nice table side presentation that was done with a warming candle.  Dinner was very well prepared.  We had the filet, sea bass, and halibut. Photo of filet is attached.  It was excellent and the flavor of the mushrooms was superb although the presentation was lacking.   It was interesting that they included a small meat pie with fillet.  The fish was well prepared and sauces we excellent, as I was told.   The best part was the desserts the preparation and flavors were wonderful. It is an experience for dinner but not of fine dining, fun dining.

-fg2dAAIgXySaJGNPgqY_g.text: The drinks here were good enough but the view made the entire experience amazing. So amazing that I found myself visiting a few times every month just to grab a drink with friends. Snagging a table next to the window is a difficult task, but the feeling of sitting on top of London will be worth the expensive drinks.

XGmd6eVv1bdo-ABxSE83ZA.text: My experience here was really under expectations. It was supposed to be a romantic dinner with my girlfriend, but instead it turned into a frustration about the quality of the service. The food was okay, the vibe and the views were amazing, but the waiters were really bad and unprofessional.- They started with bringing me the wrong whiskey.- We shared 1 starter, 1 main and 1 dessert. It took them 20 min for the started, more than 1 hour for the main and another 40 minutes for the dessert.- It is unacceptable to wait 40 minutes for a really bad dessert. We order the chocolate cake, which we didn't even finish since it was worst than a £1 cake.- I had to ask for the bill 3 times for them to bring me the bill. We got there at 8:50 and we left at 11:30. We ran out of drinks very fast and we basically waited for hours looking on the window and talking about how bad the service is.- The waiter was really unprofessional. His english and manners were really bad. We would never use full sentences he would come and say on an aggressive tone "FINISH"? In the end, I paid £230 for a bad experience. It is sad to see how such a great location is waisted by hiring unprofessional staff and serving average food at a premium price.

KVzvqXZmQzB3txnMUVMmKw.text: I came here a year ago for afternoon tea, and forgot to post a review. I just wanted to say how much I enjoyed this place, the ambience, the tea, the food, the service. I recommend people here all the time because my experience was wonderful, and I would certainly come again. Make reservations.You'll have to go through security The bathroom is beautiful (this is important to me) Enjoy the magnificent views. I'll try to find my pics to post...

HvgZ4Nn0OVHnYbxHgQobYA.text: Kind of a rip-off, noisy, not that great food but wannabe (all the bells and whistles, but no content really). Guys, putting " fennel pollen " on a dish does not save you from cooling it correctly.

KYdhs41oTOIgcBi1-jZHFg.text: Such a unique experience! My husband and I went on our honeymoon in June and it was a gorgeous restaurant. If in London, do it! They have a great drink menu that includes drinks that you would never expect! They did not disappoint. Make sure to book in advance, as they fill up quickly. The service was great, they even brought us a desert to celebrate the occasion!

fwiNhWmoGokGugkCrmL-tw.text: Unprofessional. Rude. Racist. Booked online 2 weeks in advance for 1:30pm brunch on a Sunday. Due to a change of schedule we were around the Shard earlier so I called to see if there is any table available. Aqua Shard picked up and told us "yes - please come at 12ish we have a table for you."Showed up at 12:15pm, directly got shut into the corner of the bar to "wait for the table". Waited for an hour, seeing people (even walk-ins I suspect) got their tables, with about 10 tables still empty. So we went up and asked if we can be seated yet. A very rude staff responded "your booking is 1:30pm. So no."Here I must highlight the fact that, all the people got seated before us were white people. At 1:30pm we went up to check for our table again. The same very rude staff did not even answer us - just waved his Asian colleague over to "deal with us". His staff told us "oh yeah it's very busy here, our afternoon tea only starts at 1pm. That's why you had to wait."Wait. Our booking was for brunch - which should have begun at 10:30am. So they have messed up our booking from the very beginning, and made us waited for an hour for nothing. No apologies whatsoever from this crew. I never write about any dining experience nor complain about things online - but this restaurant certainly deserves my first and last.

a89YbjnYVXxmyNdkbGLvpw.text: The stars are for the view and the view alone. Oh and it was free to get into the restaurant. 3 of us came here, Monday morning to check out the views and have a drink. My hubby and I were on holidays and our friend didn't have to work, so it was a good time to come, no crowds and we got a seat right by the window. The drinks were super expensive, small and I didn't really like mine, and it was just a mimosa, nothing special.

6oMffHBRXo9ZVTLlXmIT_w.text: Over rated maybe? Yea decent bar good view. "The uneducated tourist thing to do" Nothing spectacular.

pj0oUiEiV9FJ4EJZzWGzQQ.text: Excellent city view!  7:00 reservation works if you want to see the sunset.The food was pretty decent for this being such a tourist spot.  The service needs a lot of work: brought starters before drinks, forgot side dish order, didn't explain certain foods on the menu well, didn't take off a charge for a dessert that wasn't liked. Overall, we had an enjoyable experience and I would go back.  The food was flavored well and the view is spectacular.  Easy to get to as well as the train station is just below the Shard.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Aqua 75 similar to a French 75, so good!
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Sunset views
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Awesome dessert: David's Mess

k05LKZMPNTccDjJ0JVrTVg.text: This was my first day in London and I was very excited to begin my day with Afternoon tea. We arrived on time for our reservation and was promptly seated...with a lovely view of the staircase. WTF! I didn't travel all the way across the pond to get a view of patrons entering and exiting the restaurant. At first I didn't say anything, until I noticed three couples who came in after me being seated by the windows. That's when I became upset! When the waiter came to take our order I asked, "is it possible to get a window seat?" He replied in his charming French accent, "Anything is possible."Within five minutes we were moved to the best window seat in the house! Our experience was lovely! The waiters were attentive and friendly. The moral of the story: ask and you shall receive...a closed mouth doesn't get fed! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon Tea at the Aqua Shard...

i6fyypxLrY3Ef7SZWXgF7g.text: Basically paying for the afternoon tea time experience and the view. It's a very beautiful place, even the toilets have an awesome view. The afternoon tea pastries was ok, nothing really sticks out for me. It does come with a lot of snacks and pastries, so come hungry. Service was impeccable. Remember to make reservations! And bring your camera.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

Ou58sDLY26a0MgY615UK2A.text: The space, located on the 32nd floor of the Chard, was absolutely gorgeous. My wife and I sat right by the window with a view of the entire London skyline. It was breathtaking. Even the restroom has the same incredible view. Unfortunately, the food itself didn't match the ambiance. I ordered the Lobster Benedict and Braised Welsh hogget (which is almost like lamb but a bit older). The former was light on lobster and tasted okay. With the latter, the meat wasn't very tender or flavorful. The potatoes, which were slightly fried on the outside, were on the dry side. There was also some form of mint purée which didn't make sense to me and too strong. I drenched the meal in gravy sauce, which helped. Given the price (48 euros per person), this meal didn't meet my expectations. I recommend dropping by for a drink at the bar instead to catch the view.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Restaurant view

Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Braised Welch hogget

GvehrdMxOc3Go4Vwq8CmwQ.text: Amazing views of the city. But perhaps the worst customer service I've ever experienced. Never received our full order, had to ask for the bill 3x, etc. Don't be in a rush and don't pay your service fee here!!!

C66SANFHNxTpyhhVYT6DAQ.text: It's on the 32nd floor of the Shard, has an absolutely breathtaking view, great service, and delicious food. I ordered the scallops and bubble and squeak (duck egg over a potato mixture and a bit of truffle). The scallops were beautiful but not comparable in taste to the cauliflower soup some others ordered at our table. The bubble and squeak was really very good but overpriced for what it is - egg and potato (even with duck egg prices at what they are lol). For dessert, we ordered the hazelnut one and it was really delicious! Overall, we enjoyed the ambience and the company, but a few flaws stopped me from giving all 5 stars. Ps GO CHECK OUT THE VIEW FROM THE LOO

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Scallops

9DB0IG-gs5z15KX2SklsQw.text: The space was beautiful, and view of London was amazing. The food, I've experienced better. The steak had almost no crisp exterior. For the duck breast, it was mediocre. Drinks were a bit better, and a little more creative. I would recommend this place at the bar, perhaps less food. Recommend for those who want a great view of london!

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

R8WWrRkZGHMc8kQxLQ7O8w.text: I attempted to make a booking for Aqua Shard and instead of the date and time I wanted, an error occurred the website made me a reservation for a time that had already passed. I immediately contacted the restaurant to correct the error and received a confirmation booking for the date I initially wanted. Six days before the booking, I could no longer make it and contacted the restaurant to cancel. The policy on their website states that you will be charged if you do not provide 24 hours' notice for cancellation. However, the reservation manager said that I would be charged even though I was canceling well in advance of 24 hours because I had already made one change to the booking. When I explained that I did not agree with being charged because the policy does not state that you cannot make more than one change to the booking and that my booking was only changed the first time because the website allowed me to make a booking for a time/date that had already passed, I was told that the process is automated and my only other option would be to reschedule. When I asked to speak to another manager because I was dissatisfied with what was going on, I was told via email that "Your claims have been discussed extensively, as per the exchange of emails. I am the designated manager to review all booking enquiries, and I will now consider this matter closed, as I have completed your request ( with the alternative options offered to you, declined )."  In response to this email I asked for clarification as to whether the restaurant intended to charge my card or whether they were complying with my request to cancel the reservation without any charges, as I canceled more than 24 hours in advance.My email was ignored, my reservation was canceled, and my card was charged £75 WITHOUT MY AGREEMENT, and more than 24 hours before the date/time of my reservation. Customer service was terrible, they go against their written polices, and have fraudulent practices. Beware before making any bookings with them.Here is the booking fee policy on their website for your reference:Booking Policy: Please note that for all bar reservations there is a £30 minimum spend per person. We kindly require at least 24 hours' notice to cancel the reservation, otherwise, authorisation is given to Aqua Brit LTD, to charge a £30 per person cancellation fee to the credit card taken to confirm this booking. Due to the high volume of requests, we are unable to guarantee window tables, or any requests for a particular table. If you are running more than 20 minutes late for your reservation, your booking may not be honoured and we reserve the right to cancel the reservation if the original guest numbers are reduced by more than half. Aqua Brit Ltd may cancel a booking prior to the event without any liability being incurred whatsoever if aqua shard or The Shard is closed due to any events and circumstances beyond its control. Our dress code is Smart casual (no sports kit, shorts or flip-flops). As we are located in The Shard, please kindly be advised that all guests and their personal belongings entering the building will be subject to security screenings. Suitcases are not permitted. All guests must be over 18 years of age. Please note that you may be asked to present photo I.D. if you look under 25 years of age.

gZ42IjS7m82Pc6Xi4YUo8w.text: While the view was beautiful, the food was very average for my taste. I was a bit disappointed since the restaurant seemed really high class and the environment was amazing. The food was plated nicely, but did not satisfy me, especially for the steeper price. One come once just for the experience, but would probably not come back unless requested by another person. Maybe it would be better for drinks at night. Friendly service though, and really beautiful bathrooms too

Rak9AtLqoXskBz5ZHd5irA.text: The most over priced, bad service I have ever been to in my life.  This place is a joke.  14 people asking my food order and we couldn't get one simple drink before we ordered.  The view is amazing.  Go to the bar, don't have dinner here.

Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

BOXskbCEDOUMiqav6-YDeg.text: Luxury restaurant and at 32nd floor of Shangri-la hotel. Extreme views from top and could overlookthe Thames River.

sQSknDmylJBVde05aBPQOQ.text: This review is for the bar area only. Stopped by Aqua Shard for a late afternoon cocktail while traipsing about London. Honestly, though the view is indeed impeccable, the experience fell short of expectations for a luxury property.Don't expect a seamless arrival; first, one must proceed through a security check (with metal detector) at the ground level, before taking a dedicated elevator to the bar/restaurant area. Can't fault the security, however.Although there are some tables in the bar area, it is still unclear to me how one goes about procuring one. We were told both that they are first come, first served and then told they are reserved. The bar area was completely packed, even at 3pm, which meant finding a space was a tad challenging. Trying to get a seat involves swooping in abruptly. What was annoying was the number of spots taken up by those ordering few or low value items, lingering indefinitely, and/or loitering about when finished. There should really be more tables allocated to the bar area, a portion of which could be reserved in advance with table minimum spend amount.Once we did find a standing space at the bar, we ordered a Bellini (£15) and Belvedere Martini (£15.25) from a friendly and efficient bartender. The drinks themselves were good, and the view is incredible, even on a rainy day. However, we decided to leave after just one, as we grew weary of the whole thing.Leaving three stars mainly for the view and good bartender, without which it would probably be two.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Belvedere Martini (15.25) and Bellini (15)

vo4DhylccTacOGR27PUkWQ.text: This review is for the bar, and whether you want to be here for the bar or the restaurant, it's difficult to get in unless you have a reservation. I was turned away as a walk-in on a Saturday night, but made it in early in the afternoon the next day. Once you get in, you can understand why gaining entrance is so tough to begin with. The wrap-around bar "island" is actually rather small and, in addition to fitting 3-4 bartenders inside, fits maybe 30-40 people all around it before they start bleeding into the restaurant and imposing on diners' space. Indeed, most folks at the bar will be tourists angling for great Instagram and Facebook shots like, ahem, yours truly. As for the cocktails at the bar, they're going to be quite pricey by U.S. standards, but not so much by inner London standards, especially given the premium setting. They're all quite well-crafted, and despite the hordes of tourists descending on the bar photographing or videoing their every move, the bartenders keep quite good composure in sparing no effort towards a quality, detailed drink. In my case, I was even comped a drink by a bartender because he had to substitute a critical ingredient for another, so I was more than happy to down an extra drink on top of it.And let's not forget the real reason why folks clamor to come here. It's all about the setting. Not only does the Shard command outsized attention as a newly jarring feature of the London skyline visible for miles, but given the the bar's location high up the structure, the panoramic views - from Parliament and the London Eye to the west (most visible from the restaurant side of the floor) to the City of London and its newish skyscrapers like the Gherkin and the Walkie-Talkie directly to the north (in front the bar) and Canary Wharf towards the east (most visible from the bar). Sipping some fantastically crafted cocktails high atop London with a jaw-dropping view of the surrounding skyline? Simply one of the most amazing experiences in this little planet of ours.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view of the bar and restaurant
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view of the bar and restaurant
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view from the bar

d5vNw6hFK5fZScaMDIgN-w.text: I went to Aqua Shard for afternoon and I have to say it was a disappointment. While The Shard is quite tall the restaurant is only on the 31st floor which gives you a similar view as you would get across the river at Sky Garden. Service wasn't very good either during our visit. The food was decent but not anything special. The black pudding and salmon were my favorite savories but pretty pedestrian. The lobster wasn't bad but it was 90% bread with an almost imperceptible amount of filling. The scones we had all tasted the same, from the waiter's description it almost sounded like half were plain and half gluten free. The sweets were pretty good but couldn't save this tea alone. Overall it was quite underwhelming. On my last trip I had tea at Fortnum and Mason which was around the same cost and significantly more enjoyable. I also went over to Sky Garden and got a similar view, a coffee, and a pastry for £4. I really can't see any reason I would return to Aqua Shard

DvocIhZHiNJF7_mMX1bwFw.text: Great place for high-tea with great views of London. Reservations are highly recommended. Request for a table by the window if possible.Our overall experience wasn't as pleasant since they were extremely unaccommodating when we requested to have a window seat upon our arrival. They did not have any available which we said we would be happy to wait. We were told we could not wait. Right when we sat down, a window table became available so we requested to move tables but were denied. I did not see why this would have been such a big issue given that we had not yet ordered our food or drinks. The open window table also was not reserved by anyone else. It sat open the entire time we had brunch.

fSckUdBd597gbagfInpf3g.text: Cocktails and dinner at The Shard was one of the highlights of our trip.  Despite the advice on dress code and the promise of unless properly attired the management had the right to deny enrtry, patrons were NOT suitably dressed. The drinks are ridiculously expensive and not particularly good. We took the time to tell our server that we wanted super dry Martini's, up with a twist.  The only part of that the bartender got right was the "up".  Dinner, again super expensive.  The food was bland and didn't pass the taste test.  If we'd been wearing eye masks it would have been difficult if not impossible to know what we were eating.  Enjoy the view, that's really what it's all about.  Another for the "one and done" list.

_adsciPRwZuue6q3NMyunQ.text: This was our first tea time in London! Everything was delicious and the view was amazing! Definitely worth your money and the hype is real.

riDzkiNaxXbTaS6dLYHcBQ.text: The only value here is the spectacular view.  The service was below acceptable. We had many servers taking our orders for drinks and food and both were severely  delayed. I had to go the bar to order our drinks after being there for over 30 minutes and then was told by the bartenders i had to wait for my server.  We had  ordered drinks with 2 different waiters, and still nothing arrived timely.  The place had open tables in the middle with better views when we arrived. Before sitting, we asked to sit there; we were told they were reserved. We were there over 2.5 hrs, due to poor service and at no point  were the seats ever occupied. A lot of service people, with no service.  The food was below mediocre and extremely pricey. We reserved this dinner for our anniversary. when i asked for them to recognize my husband and bring him dessert for the occasion, they agreed, but never did it.  When we left i asked for them to call us a cab, and was told that is not there job,   Best to have a cocktail at the bar, enjoy the views and eat at just about any other restaurant other than this one.  Never again.

Nxsix2OOaxaF-yLzy3tfGA.text: If you're looking for a great view of London, skip the London Eye and have a drink at Aqua Shard! We came here based on some recommendations from friends and were so happy we did. The three of us arrived around 5:30 and were able to find a table within about 10 minutes. The waitstaff here are very attentive & we placed our drink orders. Because "when in London" I had to order a pimms cup- which was absolutely refreshing & delicious. Note that the drinks here are very £££ - but the views are fantastic! Definitely worth it to have one fancy drink here with friends and enjoy the beautiful view of London.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. pimms cup

Ey5zYWJzXdFn05wYsKAGQA.text: We had my wife's birthday yesterday at this lovely place. The service food and atmosphere was on the sky. Loved absolutely everything!! The waiters that looked after our table were professionals too mr  Kaapil and Fara(faridod) were just great!!Will definitely visit the place every now and then!Must visit place Aqua Shard

66_C4b-bzkM4TE8BM7gVSQ.text: While the food had wonderful flavor, we felt as though we were left waiting for more. My fillet was cooked perfectly however I could've used more. My wife had the lamb and was left severely underwhelmed. The flavor was divine however three 1/2" pieces are not enough to constitute a meal. The price was not worth the view and small portion sizes.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

CmKeDeOfahLaXfu4F-KJUA.text: Aqua Shard provides a beautiful space to enjoy afternoon tea and the London skyline. At £45, it is one of the more reasonably priced tea experiences available. The tea and sweets were great, but the savory food was less impressive. Our servers were polite and prompt. It is the overall experience and value that earns Aqua Shard a high star review, not necessarily the quality of the food. Reservations seem to be necessary and I would suggest dressing up a little. I think I would have felt out of place had I been dressed casually.

mWcSdosl4wrr1zQ-HU_9TA.text: Poor food but great quality food and staff. I came here with two other friends and we ordered the sirloin for £45. The meat had a lot of fat on it for an expensive steak and was rather difficult to chew even though we all ordered medium rare. However, you are coming here for the view of London which is far more cost efficient than paying to go to the observatory and getting no food. The staff is super friendly and one waiter even offered to take our picture at all the best spots around the restaurant so we could get the major city landscapes in the background.Be sure to make reservations here and dress up if you come here for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

bLsvR2N9QrLKEjadiludXw.text: I was excited to go here with my mom and have a drink with an awesome view of London. However, when we got there we realized we were underdressed, but they let us sit at a table and order drinks anyways. Because of our casual attire, the waitress didn't treat us very friendly or patiently, which definitely put a damper on the experience. She didn't really recommend drinks when we asked her to, either. The drinks we got did end up tasting pretty good and they were very aesthetically pleasing. But the waitress brought our check before we'd even finished our drinks and it seemed like she was trying to get us to leave. We were there around dinner time but it wasn't super crowded so I thought she was being a little rude and pushy. My mom and I took some pictures but the lighting wasn't that great. Overall, it was kind of a disappointing experience even though I still enjoyed the time with my mom.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Fancy cocktails!

uyRxvRF7rqsjWm4DdDGlow.text: I was here for breakfast. The service was impeccable, the views of London are probably the best around, and the food was quite good, though on the pricey side. - I had the full English breakfast which I thought was quite good. Beautiful sunny side up eggs, crispy toast, tomatoes, beans perfectly seasoned, and the black pudding was so delicious. - I also tried the lobster benedict which included a generous helping of lobster, delicious sauce, perfectly poached eggs, and a hot biscuit.Definitely recommend this place for a beautiful ambience, great service, and overall good food.

dnDg1uFgWQ-i8g-zRmf9yw.text: Aqua Shard has to be the biggest disappointment in a long time. As a foodie from San Francisco, I am hyped up for the experience, but we wanted to walk out of the restaurant when drinks took over half an hour to get and we didn't get our dinner until 2 hours later. We also sent our dinner back and walked out because all the dishes were cold. Also, one of their floor managers was so rude to one of our dinner members. Don't waste your time and money coming here. OXO, on the other hand, is an excellent choice for an incredible dining experience with London view. Though the management team at Shard offered an invitation to come back, we politely declined since we couldn't possibly subject ourselves to less than average food and service.Aqua Shard - you are a huge disappointment and embarrassment of a fine dining establishment! Need to learn from OXO and other restaurants in San Francisco!

TK02GlEFJIGiVceKluFlbQ.text: I usually reserve Yelp reviews for the really bad.I had read about how questionable the service would be at Aqua Shard. I had one more dinner left on my business trip to London. The weather has been so beautiful that I thought it would be a good time to visit Aqua Shard. I had called to see if they could seat a single cover - they were completely booked. I decided to walk in and try my luck. When I arrived, after visiting the observatory area of the Shard, I was seated pretty immediately. Everyone was really kind and I was served quickly. The only problem was a little too quickly - My fish was completely raw. The manager offered to take the fish off my bill. Another manager looking person offered me a glass of champagne on the house. After that the service started to slip. They took away my napkin from me and never returned a fresh one. A waitress dropped a dirty knife on my shoe - and it took a while to get the check. Even with those things, I still think all in all it was pretty excellent service. I was actually going to give extra tip - but there was no place to do so. The food on the other hand - I might have ordered different things next time. I would give this restaurant another chance.

0_eZiLqjmLsldNGbafp1vQ.text: The view is great but the service and food extremely disappointing. We received an unfriendly welcome for not having booked in advance for breakfast, despite there clearly being tables available. The food was average and expensive. Pastries were stale.  The coffee was served lukewarm and a simple request for hot water had to be repeated three times to two servers before it arrived.  They also add the service charge of 12.5% to your bill automatically which is a personal pet peeve for me.  Go for the view and a drink at the bar.

ObfVuggBukdZRX-QJqMUEg.text: In the middle of brunch right now, don't get the haggot or the cod, it's trash. Appetizers were good at least. Very disappointed. Should have checked Yelp before going here. At least I can say I've been to the shard.

MFDyz93r-v3sqfKP8wFDsw.text: Food was awful!!! 1 star. View was amazing and the table we got was perfect for enjoying the gorgeous views. We were seated facing the floor-to-ceiling window and the atmosphere in the restaurant was very nice. Even the bathrooms had gorgeous views, I didn't want to come out of the bathroom because of the floor-to-ceiling windows and mirrors everywhere, amazing effect. For views, I give 5 stars.Overall, however, given that we paid about $300 for dinner (husband and I) including a bottle of wine, I am disappointed with the quality of the meal. Seems like the dishes were not taste tested at all. We are not picky eaters but couldn't enjoy what was presented. Dessert was the only acceptable course. Bottom line, if you'd like an experience in the tallest building in the EU, you may try here, or the other 2 restaurants up here, but don't expect much of a meal at the Aquashard, in my opinion.

WjrtNg_iOEPVuC0w7nPw7Q.text: Horrible and rude service.Are the staffs even trained in this place?The food was also very disappointing.

dxcsW3Q6-kXOu6eUJSrCIQ.text: Thought grabbing a pricey drink was worth the price of admission rather than take the tourist lift.  I got the Southwark Sunset and it was AMAZING!  The bartender was too kind and replaced my drink when I spilled it trying to get a picture of it with the view in the background.  Go for drinks with the breathtaking view.  Worth every penny (or pence)!Go in early evening to get a table with a view!

22CSInw5RNe-BEEpurWeRA.text: For a restaurant high up in the Shard, I had low expectations for the food.  I thought that the main attraction would be the great view out over London.  As it turns out, the opposite was true for our visit for breakfast.I booked two weeks in advance for a breakfast treat.  We would both go to the Aqua Shard and have a quality cooked breakfast before going to work.  Unfortunately for us, it ended up being one of the foggiest days in London, in memory!  All we saw out of the windows, in all directions, was grey.  The staff at the restaurant were understanding and apologetic for it, but obviously, it wasn't something that they could control.We got there at 7:30am and the restaurant was almost entirely empty.  (It slowly filled up to about half full when we left an hour later.)  We were shown to our table next to the window and handed the menus to peruse.I chose the Shard breakfast and it looked magnificent!  This comprised two eggs cooked as you like (I had scrambled), sourdough toast, bacon, sausage, spinach, ricotta, hash browns, cannellini beans and black pudding.  The breakfast includes vine tomatoes, but I swapped those out for more hash brown.  If I were to be picky, I would prefer the scrambled eggs on the side, as the toast can get soggy otherwise.  The hash browns were slightly to greasy.  But, really, this was a great breakfast and set me up for the day.My wife had the Aqua Shard smoked salmon, which came with scrambled eggs, sourdough toast, corn fritters and creme fresh.  The salmon was good, but not as oily as the menu suggested.  The fritters were doughy, not so much corn was evident.We both had our usual coffees and had an orange juice each at the end of the meal.The bill came to just under £50 which is expensive for breakfast.  (I noted my flat white was £4 and I would definitely get a better one at Taylor St for close to half the price.)  If it were a clear day, this would have been a better experience and I have given them the benefit of the doubt on that point.

6yM4BHhFKlK9Zh7tVnCHTA.text: Loved this place!! Had lunch reservations and was amazed by the service, food, and especially the view! Although the food portions are small, the food was delicious. I had the pecan tart for dessert and enjoyed every bite! The view was spectacular, you could see almost all of London!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Dessert! Pecan tart
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. The menu.

v7BDAlDGp4SkWd2RFOumVA.text: Amazing. Must see in London. Expensive drinks but you need to understand where you are.

dcQTVgHN0XH_Bu4-5xWEhA.text: We had dinner here. Food was fine, the sommelier was helpful. The service was slow, so that the waiter had to tell us we didn't have time for dessert. The room is dark, the music is tedious and loud enough that four people in a booth cannot have a conversation. Feels like a tourist trap.

Bi4H7SuwkL6kjfbl1GsvIA.text: Really nice place, stunning view, good food, classy atmosphere...only problem is that is very difficult to book.Came here last week to celebrate my mum's birthday, as my parents came visiting and I wanted to book something new and memorable. So I decided to go to one of the Shard's restaurants to enjoy the view while eating. I booked more than a week in advance and a table for 3 at 22.15 on friday was the only option I could get over the entire bank holiday weekend!The place is quite dark, but it is well decorated not to overshadow the view and the low lighting is perfect to enjoy the City lighting. Table are well distantiated and the service is dicrete and polite.Speaking of the food, it claims to be a British restaurant, so I developed low expectations...instead it was really good. I had the salmon starter that was really tender and tasty and a pork main, that was really really good. My parent's food also was nice, beef starters and ribeyes, all well cooked and beautifully presented. Good wine list, quite comprehensive in terms of styles and price range. there is a big area dedicated to the american bar and it is nothing like the aqua kyoto one (loud, full of people and music), this one is really cozy and relaxed, feels a bit like a retro place or a very posh hotel bar...I'll try it soon!

TPT8kwisri2LfmgGokccxA.text: Let's face it, people go to the Shard for the view, and the view is pretty good from the 32 floor where Aqua Shard looks over the Thames and the Tower of London. We didn't eat so this review is just for drinks at the bar.You cant make reservations for drinks bookings, and although it was busy (Thursday evening) there was space to stand and admire the view. I'd say chances of getting a table are pretty slim unless you get there early or happen to be hovering nearby as someone else leaves. Bar staff were a bit thin on the ground, so by the time I got served I decided it would be quicker to forgo the cocktails and order wine.Drinks are a little on the pricey side but it's all about the location so that's to be expected. It's not somewhere that I'd go often, but it's good for peeping out at the the skyline of London or for showing off the city to out-of-towners.

Nnkvx-XimhGeiH_VSveeDg.text: Food: Meh - had the salmon for my main...too lazy to look up online what it wasPrice: £80 per personReview: Totally overrated - BUT BUT BUT, if you come here for their earl grey martinis, NOT A BAD CHOICE, BUT DO NOT EAT. Overpriced, and nothing spectacular. The service - meh, a bit disorganised, but wah the view....the view is chi chinggggg

agbXU8gTEIXw19RGgZzikw.text: Great views and good breakfast menu if you want to get ahead of the game and see the views

WB0_Q54jzoVqtN8TCJ8CEA.text: Dining with a group on our first trip to London, what do you do? Of course you book the best view! If only that was all that mattered! The service was slow, the staff had to be flagged down for everything. My fish was not cooked..the list would go on. Some things are forgivable as the waiter told us that they were short staffed but what is not forgivable is how they handled the entire situation.  After waiting 30 minutes for our table that had a times stamp on it, we were seated in what felt like a temporary table in front of the bar in between the 2 kitchen doors- so you either got a blast of light or the wind from an open door on you when the staff came hurrying through. Our "View" was blocked by another family with a similar table but at least they got a view! They told us that the first round of drinks that took 30 minutes to appear were on them. The fish would be refunded but not the side veggies that were requested to replace the fish (as NO ONE wanted to wait for a new entree). Entrees all appeared minutes apart so we sat being polite while our food got cold waiting.. They offered us complimentary dessert which seemed like they were trying until it appeared on our bill. We would have never ordered dessert had it not been free. When the bill came the waiter again apologized and acted as though he pulled strings to get 20% of the bill - which was greater than the price of the fish that wasn't cooked. The next person that picked up the bill told us the same story but only that the desserts which were free were the 20%.. Does anyone else understand how this math could possible work? Save yourself..have a drink, use the loo and go somewhere else!

NSXRn9ENc0jw9BWhL0yE1Q.text: Drinks were good enough. Not worth the prices. It felt like they were really trying hard to make us feel like we weren't good enough to be there. Super pretentious joint. For the millions of places to get a drink in London...probably will never choose this place again.

tV34V_1zM0mbhPyiodIxwQ.text: Disclaimer, I'm only reviewing the bar here.Nothing exciting often happens on a Tuesday. Unless you live with a budding actress that is who recently got accepted into a very prestigious drama school. Of course celebrations had to be had. And I had to think on my feet for this one because I had no idea she would get told she was in that day. So I gave her 15 minutes to change, booked an Uber cab (love this firm, much better than Addison Lee) and whisked her off to the shard.  31 floors up in a polished wood elevator we emerged on the restaurant deck and wandered into Aquashard for celebration drinks.No reservations for the bar, so we perched and then quickly grabbed a table by the window. This wasn't actually that difficult, I suppose it was 10pm Tuesday in a glass building, so naturally there are a lot of windows. I will say this though, the view is INCREDIBLE. As someone who hasn't been to the top of the Shard (overpriced much?) I was a little bit in awe of how beautiful London is lit up at night from this height. It helped that it was a clear night too, but even if it wasn't we didn't pay in advance for this view. The cocktail price does however reflect the location, starting at £13. Now they were nice cocktails don't get me wrong, but at that price I could name 3 nicer bars just off the top of my head. The bartenders were also very knowledgeable, helping you to choos. They did however take their sweet time; at one point I had to shout at one to let me pay, having poured me the drinks and wandered off. I know, I'm just so responsible.All in all though, we decided that this would be our career milestone celebratory cocktail bar. My turn next... Right?!

12HhfBLRbtNh51S9d_5pBA.text: Brilliant experience and exceptional food. Slightly disappointed that we couldn't wait at the bar for a window seat (we had a 9pm booking, and the two couples in front of us left very soon after we were seated) but was still great. Staff cannot be faulted, though I agree with the review that Eton mess isn't what you expect.  £185, including service charge for a bottle of wine, two starters, two mains and a dessert is actually less than I expected.  Definitely a fantastic night for a celebration.

fok8HgF-0WympdP9S9CNCA.text: Food 4.3 stars.View 5 stars.Atmosphere 5 stars. So why a 2 star rating ? Service. I was with great people and we had a nice time. I could give a few specifics but let me just say we had 6 or 7 people serving us as we had to flag down  or tired to flag down staff passing by. If the owner(s) is (are) reading this... suggest a new GM. With that small change could get a M star. New guy of course would have to fire waiters for better ones, current GM seems happy with poor servers. Shame.

6bY0-eaM4Deykke6Mjxaqg.text: Amazing drinks, view and atmosphere!!! This place is certainly a place to stop while in London. Not too dressy but certainly classy chic!

UUZqv7iv8zQMop111ehVxQ.text: We went here to get some drinks before he went to Hutong for dinner. This place was packed and I can see why, the drinks are innovative and if you can snag one of those tables with the view of the tower bridge I feel you are sorted. We unfortunately didn't get a table, we were just standing and downing ours. One of my friends had a drink with lavender in it and that drink was unlike anything I have ever had and I was very impressed. The others in the group just stuck to whiskey and beer. The bartenders were friendly. The view was to die for. Just beat in mind the place is packed and the drinks are crazy expensive.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. The view !
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. Spot tower bridge !

RdbfX4MgakW107y0BQEI2A.text: Fans of Sketch will be thrilled to be greeted by David at front of house, as you exit the lift on the 32nd floor. One floor down from your warm greeting, the Aqua Shard itself offers stunning views overlooking The City of London to the north, Tower Bridge and Canary Wharf to the east and the BT Tower toward the West. The lunchtime set menu offers some interesting dishes and is good value for money given the location. My recommendations would be the smoked salmon followed by the pork. There is a large seating area and bar which I would imagine is crowded in the evenings. In summary, good food, good value, great views. Only miss was the service which fell a little short of expectations.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view from the 31st Floor
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view from the 31st Floor
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom. view from the 31st Floor

dEvWVkhvk_BrvOVHZ8lu-A.text: OKkkkkkk, Errrrr.....little Over Rated, There I said it. Had better breakfasts at half decent greasy spoon to be honest. It's more about the experience then anything else, going up in the unbelievably fast lifts and then being hit by the great views of London. It's very pricey and the food don't liv up to the high prices and great views. It's a stunning place to be  but if your looking for a good breakfast give it a miss, If on the other hand you want to impress with views of London and live that champagne life style for a short while then this is the place.

O3x6qQrxa8VTAzcTJPaF7w.text: Good spot to watch "the beautiful people" of London get their cocktail on.  You can save on the viewing platform fee, however will probably make up for it after 2 cocktails.  Obviously a great view on clear nights and the bartenders certainly know what they're doing.  Getting someone's attention to order can be a hassle, but otherwise a good experience if you can nab some seating.  The rating reflects more that it isn't my favourite scene than any negative aspect of the evening.

ko8KkVc5PT9CFiISH7hxYw.text: Our meal at Aqua shard was "ok". If the food and service was as good as the bathroom (a must see - I'll leave the details as a surprise) and view I would have given this restaurant a 5/5. However, the service seemed to be equivalent to a moderate chain restaurant and the food overpriced and prepared with little effort. I have had many goat cheese salads in my experience and this starter here was disappointing. It was a pile of lettuce with a few "drops" of goat cheese splattered around the plate. The appearance was a let down, as was the dish. I've never felt more strongly that this was a "money generator" dish. It probably cost a tenth of what they charged for it. I've made better at home. Enough with the rant about the salad...The service was lacklustre and I felt as if he staff was just there to take our order and give us our food. Silverware was misplaced for particular dishes, crumbs were left on the table and there was no effort to go "above and beyond" to make our dinner special. Picky detail - we were served red wine in white wine glasses while the table next to us was given red wine I. Red wine glasses.Let down- 2/4 of my party ordered the pork belly only to be told afterwards they were "out". The menu was very small to begin with and this should have been pointed out ahead of time or removed from the menu. Even better don't run out of pork belly. On a positive note, we were given a table with a great view upon request on line.MAIN TAKEAWAYGo to aqua shard bar and order a bottle of the cheapest wine (all are good quality and delicious). Enjoy the view and then go have some food at a better restaurant (or Burrough market right down the street).

gR9baz4khPDCmEc4W6AQaQ.text: Came here with my work crew for dinner and drinks mid-week. I hadn't read the reviews, but heard this place was amazing. I was mostly disappointed with the service. We spent decent money, and were out of the booth in 1.5 hours. The service was pretentious, rude, and impatient. Maybe this is the thing they are going for, in which case they should raise their prices to match. The food quality was mediocre. I had the pork belly, which was just a slab of fatty meat - no flavouring or sides. I will give two stars because the ambiance is actually nice, not stiff but more loungey and comfortable.

rKpWWSiM4AgGBcnh4RZV5w.text: Great view! We had afternoon tea there, it was lovely. However the sandwich was strange, perhaps because it was cut in different shapes rather than the traditional size, emm still feel strange. Sandwich wasn't tasty. Tea was great! Very expensive though! £58 per person plus a glass of champagne.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

ae9xt8jXAgFeN-kATj6z8w.text: You can't book for the bar here, which is a mixed blessing - on the one hand, it's nice to have the option to just turn up, on the other, it's pretty popular, so you may have to wait a while to get served, and stand.  That said, it doesn't seem to be the type of place where people linger for too long, but is more likely somewhere to call by on the way to or from somewhere else, which does mean there's a reasonable turn-around of tables and seats freeing up.I showed up just after 7.30pm on a Saturday with a small group of friends, and once we'd worked out the best spot to order from, we didn't have to wait too long for our cocktails. We were also fortunate that another group were just finishing and were kind enough to let us know and offer us their seats before anyone else snagged them.The setting is really quite spectacular and it feels very decadent walking down the steps and looking into the glittering sea of sparkling lights reflected in the floor to ceiling windows and out over the river view (which probably accounts for the premium you're paying on the drinks!).It feels like a great place to start a night out, so I'll certainly return, and the venue is sure to impress if you've got friends visiting from out of town.

photos.caption: Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Aqua Shard - London, United Kingdom

XN0uqFvWCZ0HlqU8yFmKPw.text: Not impressed because of the Wimbledon Cocktail ordered smelled like fish & just the presentation of the drink was not pleasant enough to look at. 2nd, the food I ordered were clams based on the description but food served was fillet of fish. 3rd, overpriced...not worth it. 4th, waiters/waitresses were not friendly. The only thing nice about the place is seeing the view outside. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant at all.

6xKMubKzXuSmy9DRjW3zqg.text: Disappointed by our visit to Aqua. We went on a Sunday evening and it was very busy. The food was very nice. But the disappointment came from ordering a very expensive bottle of champagne for it to be placed in an ice bucket far away from the table, but then the waiter not bothering to fill us up! I had to get up more than twice to go and retrieve the bottle and fill it up myself. Not what you'd expect given the price!

iwFG5GonIYYo6019OHe2FQ.text: One of our service providers at work recently moved to The Shard and I was glad that they decided to move our planned lunch to one of the restaurants in the building. The setting was spectacular and as we were early the maitre'd showed us the restaurant complex including the Chinese on the 33rd floor. The views over London where stunning, I could see Primrose Hill from where I was sat. There was even the novelty factor of the urinals looking out over London, a very scenic toilet experience. The food solid but nothing special. For starters I had goats cheese and tomato salad. For mains roast chicken and vegetables and desert I had the coffee and chocolate moose. All courses came from the set menu which was £28 per head which considering the location is pretty reasonable. They like to give the impression that they are incredibly busy but the place was only a third full. In any event it is wise to book ahead.I will definitely try and came back in future even if it is only for evening drinks.

UXjJX4W2minAjN_yOTqcJw.text: I went to Aqua Shard with a few of my friends for some drinks. After arriving in the lobby shared by both Aqua Shard and Oblix, we proceeded to Aqua Shard where I was told I could not enter due to not having slacks or jeans on. I had on very nice and expensive linen shorts, a polo, and nice loafers/boat shoes, yet I was not allowed to enter because of it. Funny thing is a handful of women before me walked in with VERY short skirts and booty shorts, yet that was acceptable for some reason. I was not offended, by this issue, but rather confused as to why is applied to some, but not others. I just went over to Oblix and had drinks there with my friends. The service was much better appreciated.

e8TWeZMyeCoozfkQOz1MqQ.text: The service was incredibly slow and the breakfast over-priced and not very special. The lobster benedict sounds awesome on paper but the hollandaise was way too thick and spicy to match the eggs. Such a shame!

E7_ohLxJKs0q_JVBDvnR2w.text: I always suspend my belief in negative reviews and I am glad I did with Aqua Shard.Organised a brunch for me and my crew to welcome back my best friend from Japan. The views are stunning, so no need to gush any further about that however, the environment, food and service were equally lovely.We had a few different selections from the brunch menu and none disappointed in flavour. My friend did have to ask for hot sauce for her oysters - not sure why there was no cup given with this order along with a vinagrette. Oh well. No issue.The complimentary cocktail is a nice touch and considering how hot it was outside it was quite refreshing as was the air conditioning. Side note, can London please get out of the dark ages with the no air-con in your venues please? Rant over.Our servers were prompt and non-intrusive. They assisted a couple in my party with some drink choices too. Reservations are a must and they turn tables at Aqua Shard but we were not rushed to vacate.Yes, this is all about the views and they have added an ample amount of mirrors inside and the bathrooms to give the illusion of even more space but it does work. In fact, we liked the mirror clad bathroom-haha!The prices are not for the faint hearted but we could not fault the food. I would not pay the price again but I can say, we did not need to eat for the rest of the day because it was substantial and tasty.We then went to the bar area for more drinks. This area is smaller, err, cramped by the windows for the obvious reason. I did not like that so much but we were seated and enjoying our time here. The other things I found unsettling, kids and grubby wear from a few patrons. This is not your local boozer so leave your kids at home along with your tatty trainers,mingin' jeans and logo tee'sOverall, Aqua Shard was really very good and a special venue for our special event.

KZ19JJM75ULJYad6MMQNRw.text: Great view, terrible food. Booked for a party of 6, and they managed to mess up our drink order. Brought two wrong cocktails, and two bottles of white wine when we ordered a bottle of red and a white, which still wasnt the right white wine regardless. Ordered the foie gras, which left me extremely disappointed as it was very bland. The tuna carpaccio was also bland as I was told from everyone else. Ordered the short rib, which was highly recommended because the mayonnaise sauce was "extremely addictive and highly rated". It was cooked well, very tender but had no flavor. Left half of it uneaten. Not worth the 700£ spent. Drinks are their specialty, but considering that I asked for a round of lychee shots they didnt have, so i told him to tell the bartender to get creative something fruity with vodka, and he responds with "the bartender is busy and doesnt have time for games, but he recommends coffee patron" which is nothing near what I asked. Wouldnt come back even if it was free although the view from the bathroom is superb!

14jDwA6IjQSOWzsMvXoMEw.text: The perfect place if you don't want to see or hear the person(s) you are dining with.  Staff is unfriendly, lack knowledge of limited, uninteresting menu, seemed overwhelmed with volume (on a Sunday evening), in no rush to take additional drink order when asked, or provide a bill.  After 25 minutes with the bill ready to pay, I eventually checked out at the bar with the assistance of my i-phone flash light to get me there.Be warned they have stiff penalties for not only cancelling a reservation, but also for changing the time or the number of people in your party.  Think you can just have a drink to take the view, be ready for a significant minimum food order...A better choice with equivalent view, but with excellent service and menu is Sushi Samba nearby.

Vcd2EH9-qPCrZT8vRZmzgQ.text: You go here for the views more than anything else.  Having a glass of prosecco with a view of the city is a great experience to have, but know that you will pay £15 for that glass, and another £5 for a coffee.  I came for lunch once and the view and service was great, but the food was just okay, and the servers kept trying to upcharge us (convinced us to have sides by claiming that the sides that came with the steak were puny - they weren't).  The view is great - just know what you're getting into.

xGute9-Yo-6rRQrSmt6PDg.text: Had a drink here a couple of weeks ago. They were very accommodating of our group of 4 plus 2yr old and even provided a babyccino on request which was appreciated. The cheapest wine - £44 a bottle - was delicious and the atmosphere nice, a mix of tourists and posh people. It was really expensive, but then it is half way up the shard. The service was so friendly, and we were made to feel so welcome (despite us being in sandals and rain coats etc) that I would come again... after payday!

GBvOVilZdwiFE1oxEjzNVw.text: My friend treated me to breakfast here for my 40th birthday- and I loved it! We had reserved for 9am but turned up a little early and so were lucky enough to get a seat right at the window. The views are stunning, well worth a visit for that alone. The breakfast menu has lots of choice, so you really don't  need to spend a fortune. Prices are on the high side, but coffee and toast wouldn't break the bank. We opted for something a bit more lavish- the eggs Benedict were just fabulous. Service was prompt, if not speedy- we did get the feeling that they weren't encouraging us to linger. We decided to order a second cafetiere of coffee so we could enjoy the view a bit longer. When it didn't arrive after quite some time, we asked about it- only a couple of minutes later it arrived, and we were told it was on the house since we'd been waiting so long- bonus! I think a window seat definitely enhances the experience; you can see the view from pretty much any seat in the place, but it's best from nearest the windows. Unfortunately I don't think you can guarantee this when you book; you just have to take your chance on he day. My advice would be to show up a bit early for your booking. Would definitely recommend as an experience to try- and the food's pretty good too!
